ticket.description:
Tested in both 1.6 and 2.0.
When uploading a large file (50GB in our case) through Internet Explorer 11, the upload stalls somewhere halfway. We've received reports stating that they stop at 12%, in my own tests they've stopped at 48% in FileSender 2.0 and 78% in FileSender 1.6. The log files make no mention of anything amiss. I wasn't able to reproduce this with other browsers.
Tested with Internet Explorer 11 on Windows Server 2012R2, got reports about Internet Explorer 11 on Windows 7.
ticket.summary: Large files stall on Internet Explorer 11

ticket.description: Placeholder ticket
ticket.summary: Release 1.6

ticket.description:
(theory start)
When uploading a huge file slowly at some point the computer goes to sleep.
That ends up having incomplete chunk upload requests being sent (400 code by apache, php not executed).
After computer awakes the stalled transfer mechanism triggers (no feedback from workers over too long) but transfer cannot be restarted because XSRF token expired.
(theory end)
We need a mechanism able to figure out that nothing happened over more than XSRF token lifetime and refresh said token (not over WS call obviously, more like an hidden iframe in which we load the home page and fetch the token from it, possible since same domain).
This could be an extension of stalled transfer detection.
ticket.summary: Upload broken by computer sleep mode (it seems)
Session-cookies must always be transmitted encrypted #11.3

ticket.description: Date: Fri, 16 Oct 2009 11:57:02 +0200 From: Hans Zandbelt Reply-To: filesender-dev@filesender.org To: filesender-dev@filesender.org Cc: coin-tech@surfnet.nl Subject: [filesender-dev] PostgresSQL integer field out of range Hi, We encounter the following error for large file sizes in Beta 0.1.2: PHP Warning: pg_query() [function.pg-query]: Query failed: ERROR: value "3573778432" is out of range for type integer in /usr/local/simplesamlphp_1_4/www/filesender/fs_main.php on line 291 it looks indeed like the type of the filesize column in the database is plain 32-bits signed "integer" on which the PostgresSQL docs say: integer 4 bytes usual choice for integer -2147483648 to +2147483647 Since filesender is meant to facilitate exchange of large files with positive sizes, I'm sure there exists a better type to suit this behaviour. According to: http://www.postgresql.org/docs/8.0/interactive/datatype.html#DATATYPE-INT there's no such thing as an unsigned long, but bigint 8 bytes large-range integer -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807 might do a better job. Regards, Hans. -- Hans Zandbelt hans.zandbelt@surfnet.nl SURFnet http://www.surfnet.nl
ticket.summary: PostgresSQL integer field out of range

ticket.description:
if a user is logged in and has filesender open in two browser tabs, and the user then logs off in one of the two browser tabs, the “New Upload” page on that logged-off browser tab remains active. This is a security risk on public machines such as available in university libraries. The Vouchers and MyFiles pages in that logged-off tab however do correctly display: “There has been an error loading voucher data. Please check Log File. notAuthenticated”
(arguably, "voucher data” isn't correct for the MyFiles page, but that is cosmetics, not security).
ticket.summary: security: log-off behaviour across multiple browser tabs incorrect

ticket.description: After creating a voucher, voucher is deleted on cleanup - incorrect SQL.

ticket.description: *Current scenario:* 1. click on Log Off button, 2. Log On page appears while logout process continues, 3. Log out page appears and user is now logged out. *Security risk:* If the user closes the browser tab when they see the Logon page, assuming their logout is complete (which is reasonable), the logoff process stops. If they (or someone else if using a public machine such as at a library) then opens FileSender in a new tab, the previous user will still be logged in. *Suggested resolution:* only display the Logon and / or Logoff pages once logoff is complete (in fact, isn't one of these pages enough, does it really need both?)
ticket.summary: security: user still logged in if closes tab when login page appears, prior to logout page appearing

ticket.description:
Duplicate from versoin 1.5 See related ticket.
When trying to upload files nearing the 2G limit (1900 to 2047 MB) it looks like Flash (?) runs out of memory. With FF the browser crashes, with Opera the progress popup appears but nothing happens (also no network activity). Also Cancel doesn't work and reloading the page will crash Opera also. Selecting a somewhat smaller file (in my case 1536 MB) results with both browsers in a period of disk read activity (and the spinning ball in FF) after which the upload actually starts.
This looks like Flash (?) tries to read the complete file into memory which may or may not be available. Can this be made less memory hungry?
Seen on Mac OS 10.5.8 with Flash 10.3.183.5 and FF 3.6.19 and Opera 11.50. MacBook 5.1 with 4G RAM.
ticket.summary: Hanging Flash uploads of large (free memory dependent) files on Mac

ticket.description:
The audit log is supposed to give an overview of what happend to a transfer when and by whom.
The current audit log is implemented in such a way that it stores identifiers to for example a recipient entry in the recipient table rather than the actual values. Deleting a recipient leads to dangling identifiers in the audit log. This again breaks audit log viewing in the web interface and sending the audit log by email.
There are several ways to solve this, not all are equally desirable. We need to revisit what exactly the audit log shoudl provide as a feature before making a decision. This ticket will be linked to a feature specification ticket for that reason.
ticket.summary: Bug: Recipient removal breaks audit log

ticket.description:
by default, the way filesender sends emails (impersonating the sending user) is not SPF-compliant. Two alternative schemes have been implemented in/around filesender to mitigate the issue.
- one provides SPF compliance using an SRS scheme implemented through EXIM4 and a separate SRS daemon, described here: http://www.assembla.com/wiki/show/file_sender/Configuring_SRS_with_Exim_%28Debian_and_Ubuntu%29
- another reverts to filesender sending emails as itself (omitting the impersonation), and making use of additional code to tag outgoing emails and parse their headers should they bounce, thus enabling filesender to forward any bounces to the sending user. This method is described here: http://www.assembla.com/wiki/show/file_sender/Mail_Bounce_Handling
Both procedures have been tested and are proven to work; I believe it's time to choose one as the default developmental route.
ticket.summary: mail bounce handling: decision time
Security flaw (under specific conditions) : user remote credentials leak

ticket.description:
Chrome 32 and FF 27 will under circumstances request a partial download. With large files the requested byte-range can be too large for the current solution and will trigger a memory limit:
Feb 19 14:04:40 filesender apache2: PHP Fatal error: Allowed memory size of 134217728 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 2147483648 bytes) in /usr/share/filesender/www/download.php on line 176
Currently the whole requested byte range is loaded into memory.
Raising the limit might not be the best solution. Other possible solutions:
- chunk the requested range (as with a full download) ? - disable it for now? - ???
ticket.summary: Memory exhaustion with partial download of large files
[security] 2.7.3 Escape/validate user input before using it in filenames

ticket.description:
Currently the progress bars only update at the end of a chunk. This is extremely undesirable with slow upload speeds as it seems as though no progress is being made for a very long time (especially if the default chunk size is high).
A working solution for this exists only in the context of Mozilla Firefox (Tested 23.0.1) which has full support for using xhr.upload.onprogress events with Javascript web workers.
This solution does not apply to Google Chrome (Tested version 29.0.1547.57 m) which has support for xhr.upload.onprogress events but NOT in the context of web workers (the event will only fire at the end of a chunk, and no time before).
Solution does not apply to Internet Explorer (Tested on version 10.0.92) which does NOT have support for xhr.upload.onprogress events but DOES have limited support for xhr.onprogress but web workers will still not update this constantly, only at the end of a chunk.
ticket.summary: Increase update frequency on html5 uploads
document config options site_temp_filestore and cron_cleanuptempdays
update administrator guide with new configuration options

ticket.description:
Date: Thu, 22 Oct 2009 15:49:37 +0200 From: Hans Zandbelt <hans.zandbelt@surfnet.nl> Reply-To: filesender-dev@filesender.org To: filesender-dev@filesender.org Subject: [filesender-dev] [feature] configurable attribute names
Hi,
I would like the hardcoded attribute names in fs_param.php to be configurable through config/config.xml since variable names can differ between different IDPs/federations. Eg. we now have for SURFfederatie:
$username = $session->getAttribute('urn:mace:dir:attribute-def:displayName'); $useremail = $session->getAttribute('urn:mace:dir:attribute-def:mail');
instead of the default "short" names that come in version 0.1.3.
Thanks,
Hans.

ticket.description:
Date: Thu, 22 Oct 2009 15:46:40 +0200 From: Hans Zandbelt <hans.zandbelt@surfnet.nl> Reply-To: filesender-dev@filesender.org To: filesender-dev@filesender.org Subject: [filesender-dev] [feature] version 0.1.3 database creation script
Hi,
Can I suggest to drop te "WITH (OIDS=FALSE)" clause from the table creation statements?
It seems to be incompatibile with PostgreSQL 8.1.18 which comes with Redhat Enterprise Linux 5.4; above that there's also a "default_with_oids" configuration parameter which sorts it out for newer installations on a system level.
This way at least the PostgreSQL version requirement can be narrowed down from "latest version" to ">= 8.1.18".
Regards,
Hans.
-- Hans Zandbelt hans.zandbelt@surfnet.nl SURFnet http://www.surfnet.nl
--- filesender_db.sql.org 2009-10-19 11:43:00.000000000 +0200 +++ filesender_db.sql 2009-10-22 15:39:16.000000000 +0200 @@ -18,8 +18,7 @@ fileexpirydate timestamp without time zone, fileactivitydate timestamp without time zone, CONSTRAINT files_pkey PRIMARY KEY (fileid) -) -WITH (OIDS=FALSE); +); ALTER TABLE files OWNER TO postgres; GRANT ALL ON TABLE files TO postgres; GRANT ALL ON TABLE files TO public; @@ -58,6 +57,5 @@ logmessage text, logvoucheruid character varying(60), CONSTRAINT logs_pkey PRIMARY KEY (logid) -) -WITH (OIDS=FALSE); -ALTER TABLE logs OWNER TO postgres; \ No newline at end of file +); +ALTER TABLE logs OWNER TO postgres;
ticket.summary: database creation script improvement suggestion for version 0.1.3

ticket.description:
Files linked via a common groupID should be organised such that their common fields (subject, message, expiry date, total number of downloads, total size) should be displayed as an upload. This should be expandable to find out details about the individual files of the upload (name, size, number of times downloaded).
Single file uploads should be displayed similar to the way they are already displayed but with styling that is consistent to the changes mentioned above.

ticket.description:
'Pause/Resume' 'Suspend' and 'Cancel' buttons need to be added to the progress bar dialog box.
Pause should *temporarily* stop the uploading of files until the user chooses to resume them (via the same button). Using this will *not* allow the user to resume after leaving this page and is used to relieve the users bandwidth temporarily.
Suspend should make it possible for users to stray away from the transaction and continue it as part of another session, this would be an explicit version of the pause/resume functionality which is currently in place. Users should be warned after choosing 'suspend' of how it works and the steps required to come back to this transaction. This should be paired with functionality which tells users they have a pending upload transaction and should continue to ask them if they wish to either continue with the upload or cancel it. This will only work when the user uses the same browser&computer combination to resume the upload. Some way, for example via a button/dropdown list/dialog for the user to access a list of their suspended transactions. This stops the user from having to repopulate the list themselves and would essentially make the uploads page re-appear how they left if (any file uploads complete in that transaction would still be there with complete progress bars). Suspended transactions should have some form of expiration date. Requires validations/error checks to ensure the pending files still exist on disk.
Cancel should forfeit the transaction and stop *all* files (both those already finished and those in the queue). Downloads do not have to be paused to be cancelled, but a warning 'are you sure?' should be provided.
ticket.summary: Pause / Resume on (Multi)file Uploads

ticket.description: Currently the download API only allows for full downloads. Adding the possibility to also use the 'partial download' using byte-ranges (Content-Range) makes it (amongst others) possible to do (in a future client-side implementation) for example pause/resume for downloads. For now this is only a back-end change, it is not used by the frontend and it also does not enable standard 'pause download' browser functionality.
ticket.summary: Make partial download (Content-Range) possible

Ensure you cache any existing content in the To: box in case someone already entered 30 email addresses and then *unticks* the "only send email to self" box. Email to self tick box around the recipient To: # Daily aggregate overview of activity (both uploads and downloads) # Spam me (email receipt for each download) A sender always receives an upload confirmation *unless* the "send file to myself" option is ticked. Note: separate email for "upload confirmation" and "here's a file to download". A download URL is always presented in the "upload complete" landing page. Consideration: mention explicitly that you can also download individual files one at a time through the download page

ticket.description:
Noted with FireFox and a largish file and with Safari 6.0 (but that one is not 'formally' supported console log in FF: 

[....]
14:52:13.881] POST https://filesender.surfnet.nl/crypto/fs_upload.php?type=chunk&vid=69088561-58ad-2c09-1b09-00004b7e9d23 [HTTP/1.1 200 OK 117ms]

ticket.description:
Currentky some debug statements will add a log entry to the filesender logfile (not the specific CRON logfile). When that logfile doesn't exist yet it will be created but owned by the root user. That will meand that the web user gets:
Warning: fopen(/var/www/filesender-proto/log/20111024.log.txt) [function.fopen]: failed to open stream: Permission denied in /var/www/filesender-1.5-svn/includes/ErrorHandler.php on line 97 can't open file
ticket.summary: cron.php when logging (logEntry) creates logfiles owned by root

ticket.description: Current workflow depends partly (a.o. for voucher uploads) on PHP session specific variables. Since a PHP session is browser specific and cannot (without extrs measures) distinguish between actions done from different browser tabs or windows this will 'break'for example simultaneous voucher uploads (multiple uploads using a voucher from the same browser session at the same time). We might need extra code to generate a window/tab specific identifier that can be used to separate actions. See a.o. http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.session.php#74557
ticket.summary: PHP session management and multiple tabs/windows per browser

ticket.description: If a voucher recipient uses a voucher to send a file to themselves, the initial upload email is bcc'd to the voucher issuer but a resent email ("Re-Send Email" button in "My Files" table) is not (the resent email is still sent to the voucher receipient).

ticket.description: Need an overview of what actually needs to be changed.

ticket.description: There is an issue, (think french language file :), it needs to be fixed to prevent longer term issues but is not a blocking issue for beta release. Note though that if we release *with* this issue, we do need to document how Claude solved it.
ticket.summary: Handling single quotes in (new) language files

ticket.description:
Goal: end-to-end data confidentiality and authenticity.
Viewing FileSender as a file transport channel, encryption is preferably done end-to-end, where all data leaves the sender's client encrypted and gets decrypted on the receivers client. The server should never see plaintext data. If this is not viable, server-side encryption can be considered to improve "at rest" protection. Note that the effects are different though:
* Client-side: data is *never* plain text on the server: a server hack would have no influence (provided the javascript served to users isn't changed ;)
* Server-side: data is plain-text on the server until encrypted *after* upload, and plaintext after decryption before download
Important constraints: -encryption functionality must be possible without provisioning stuff to the user. The user should be able to use it without installing anything. This implies it ought to be done using plain javascript. -encryption functionality must not imply additional server-side infrastructural requirements to f.ex. get a key to a user (sms gateway). This is nice added functionality, but we must maintain a filesender install that is fully functional with least possible server-side complications -the encryption key must not be transferred using the same channel as the download link is transferred
It is perfectly acceptable to have this "power funcionality" only work in HTml5 fileAPI supporting browsers
Note that as soon as we have this working, we also need to investigate signed javascript: in the scenario where a FileSender server is hacked, end-users need to be able to rely on the integrity of the javascript code used for encryption. It looks like this ought to be possible: http://answers.uchicago.edu/page.php?id=19495
ticket.summary: end-to-end File Encryption [XL]

ticket.description:
Allow users to send multiple files in one transaction to the recipient(s).
constraints: -this functionality needs to work in HTML5 FileAPI enabled browsers, gracefull fallback for older browsers is not needed -if there is more then one recipient, they all receive the same files
thoughts: -Preferably an entire folder can be selected and uploaded without problems -Downloading might be a challenge. Maybe two different downloads: one for HTML5 browsers where you can also create a folder if need be, one for non-html5 browsers where you download it as a .zip? Users no longer understand how to make .zips, but clicking on it appears to work just fine on most client-platforms.
ticket.summary: multiple file upload [XL]

ticket.description:
Gears upload works fine, flash upload doesn't over https.
Preliminary trouble investigation showed this is ONLY an issue for FireFox. With IE and Safari it works just fine. Several sources on the web state that supplying the site with a non-selfsigned SSL certificate fixed the issue. I'll try that and if it works at least there's a workaround. Still, the software shouldn't mandate someone to buy a server cert.

ticket.description:
If the file is uploaded, stored on disk, entered into the database, but the email doesn't get sent, there is a PHP error that gets reported. The user currently doesn't get any feedback. This must change.
Probable solution: make this part of some visible feedback thing to the user that shows *all* steps that need to be taken before the transaction is completed and turns the various steps green (or shows some vertical progress bar in front of them slowly turning green.
like <red> enter email address <red> select file <red> file uploaded <red> email sent
where the red slowly turns into green as the proces sprogresses.
ticket.summary: give user error message when email doesn't get sent after succesful upload

ticket.description:
in beta 1.7 r1, if a user enters invalid recipient email addresses, or uses the semicolon to separate recipient addresses, no warning is thrown up, but when subsequently a file is selected and the "send file" button is pushed, the warning thrown up is "browse for a file" -- even when a valid file has already been selected. It would seem that the error message should instead be to "check email address" or "use comma to separate email addresses".
UPDATE: this behaviour isn't completely eradicated, as reported by a beta tester on the AARNet 0.1.12 deployment. Completely omitting the domain part of the email address still seems to trigger this bug. This is the report:
-----Original Message----- From: David Badger [mailto:david.badger@flinders.edu.au] Sent: Wednesday, 28 April 2010 2:58 PM To: Guido Aben Subject: Re: suspected CloudStor bug in 0.1.12
Guido,
I've just uploaded a file to check out the latest version and (having been interrupted while entering the recipient email address) I went through the rest of the process, clicked 'Send' and got the message 'Please select a file to upload'. It took me a little while to work out that the problem wasn't that I hadn't selected a file; it was that the recipient address was clearly incomplete. I was impressed that it did test for a valid email address though! (once I figured out that that's where the problem was.) The incomplete address which triggered the error message was: "david.badger@" Once I fixed that, it was quite happy to send the file I had originally selected. So the error message needs to relate to the field causing the error.
Best wishes David
ticket.summary: incorrect warning ("browse for a file") on invalid recipient email input

ticket.description:
If a user is already logged in to filesender, clicking on a voucher link in an email takes the user to the standard Upload page, not a voucher upload page, with the user's logged in email address in the from: field (which can be different to the voucher recipient email address for that user! Users can have one email address associated with their account, and another email address they use casually), with the user's login name at the top of the page but no logoff button diplayed.
From then on the file uploaded gets treated like a new file, not a voucher file, hence the file gets listed in the MyFiles table, and the voucher does not get deleted after use.
Contrast this with previous filesender behaviour, where filesender did not "recognise" a voucher user even if already logged in.
ticket.summary: unexpected voucher behaviour when voucher user is already logged in

ticket.description:
uploaded a 4Gb file, using a voucher, against the 0.1.13 install on the AARNet server. Client was WinXPSP3, Firefox 3.6.3, Gears 0.5.36.0
File uploads completely; but at completion I am presented with a popup "cannot move file". I close that popup, and then the main screen reads "your file has been sent"
I then receive the download link in my email, and this download link *works* -- I can download the file
*but* -- the file does not appear in the admin logs under "files available" nor under "uploads". It *does* appear under "errors", as "Cannot Move file from Temp Folder".
The download then concludes successfully; the original file is identical to the downloaded copy and I am issued with the usual successful-download email. Incidentally, the download progress bar stalled at 54%
The download event itself, however, isn't listed in the admin interface either.
ticket.summary: uploading file using voucher: "cannot move file"

ticket.description: uploading of this filename: "Ellen''s stuff100507.zip" failed with a "Cannot Move file from Temp Folder" Renaming the file to "Ellen100507.zip" made the transfer go through successfully.

ticket.description:
When removing outdated files from the files-dir, if the file is already gone you get the error "There has been an error loading configuration data. Please check Log File" and a line beneath that complains about line 91 in classes/Functions.php. In such situations the database should be updated to show what remains on disk instead of preventing the use of the system as is the case now. The real problem is the line 
 if (file_exists($FilestoreDirectory."/".ensureSaneFileUid($row["fileuid"]).sanitizeFilename($row["fileoriginalname"]))) {
in cleanup() If ensureSaneFileUid gets an empty fileuid, it triggers an error that needs to be caught and dealt with here. Workaround: manually delete file-entries from the database.
ticket.summary: Outdated files in database that misses from disk halts system while removing outdated files

ticket.description:
When trying to upload files nearing the 2G limit (1900 to 2047 MB) it looks like Flash (?) runs out of memory. With FF the browser crashes, with Opera the progress popup appears but nothing happens (also no network activity). Also Cancel doesn't work and reloading the page will crash Opera also. Selecting a somewhat smaller file (in my case 1536 MB) results with both browsers in a period of disk read activity (and the spinning ball in FF) after which the upload actually starts.
This looks like Flash (?) tries to read the complete file into memory which may or may not be available. Can this be made less memory hungry?
Seen on Mac OS 10.5.8 with Flash 10.3.183.5 and FF 3.6.19 and Opera 11.50. MacBook 5.1 with 4G RAM.
ticket.summary: Hanging Flash uploads of large (free memory dependent) files on Mac

The correct confirmation page is still displayed for authenticated uploads with HTML5 - tested with FF 12.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8. As at r.1416. May be related to #722.

ticket.description: When issuing a Guest Voucher, after clicking on "Send Voucher" the message "Voucher Sent" does not appear and the page does not refresh, although the voucher has been issued and emails generated. This leaves the recipient email address still in the "Send Vouchers to:" field, the expiry date as the date selected by the user (if applicable) and the new voucher is not displayed in the table. However if the page is refreshed by the user, the fields reset and the issued voucher appears in the table. Note that if one clicks on the "Send Voucher" button a second time before manually refreshing the page, a second voucher will also be issued (and listed in the table when manually refreshed).

ticket.description: When the page is refreshed after pausing an HTML5 or Flash upload using a voucher, the url of the refreshed page ends in /index.php?s=upload#. If I am also logged on in another tab, the refreshed page displays "Welcome [...]" and all action buttons, while if I am not already logged on the refreshed page presents the Logon page. If I then try to continue (in the case where I am also logged on in another tab) by restarting or resuming the upload, after clicking on "Send" the valid email address which had been accepted for the initial upload is rejected "Invalid or missing email". Note that if I click on the "Back" button in the browser, it takes me to the url for the voucher with "#" at the end (with "Welcome Guest" and only the "Help", "About" and "Logon" buttons displayed in the header), then if I go back further I reach the initial voucher upload page. Seen using FF 12.0 and Safari 5.0.5 on Mac OSX with Flash 11.2.202.233.

It is also preserved in all of these cases (subject and message of email as well as the subject and message fields of both the "My Files" table and the "Download" page) when uploaded (authenticated or using voucher) with FF 12.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8 (no Flash).

ticket.description: Strange things can happen when FileSender is served via HTTPS but the site_url mentions http. In this case, the user was able to log in but not upload, the error message was terasender_source_file_not_available which of course is not very descriptive. I suggest the following behaviour: If $_SERVER['HTTPS'] && $_SERVER['HTTPS'] != 'off' and site_url does *not* start with https://, then log a warning. The reason for not detecting the opposite, is that the detection may be fooled by a reverse proxy.
ticket.summary: Log a warning when observed protocol is more secure than site_url

ticket.description: The configuration manual mentions `auth_remote_signature_algorithm` but no matter how I set it, the Files.sha1 field is never populated.
ticket.summary: auth_remote_signature_algorithm is not used

ticket.description:
Issue: avg. upload speed counter goes berzerk after an upload restart.
Solution: We keep track of the time upload is started or restarted (reset at restart), for each file: got global size and uploaded size. In order to know how fast we go, we take total time it took and do a division. At one point we reset one counter and not the other. Need to know “this transfer is restarting”, need to get sum of offsets, and substract it from speed computation.
ticket.summary: Fix average upload speed counter to work properly after upload resume

ticket.summary: Apply consistent updated BSD license to all files in 2.0 source tree

ticket.description:
When I run createtransfer.php as my own user, I get a lot of the following error message: 
failed to open stream: Permission denied in /usr/local/filesender/filesender-2.0/classes/utils/Logger.class.php on line 353
When I run it as root instead it works, but now I get this error when I try to run FileSender from the webbrowser. This happens because createtransfer.php may create a new logfile, and this new logfile will then be owned by the user that ran createtransfer.php. The following things need to be taken care of: * If log files can't be written, the script should abort. * If log files can be written, they should either be chowned to the webserver, or made group-writeable.
ticket.summary: Using `createtransfer.php` must check that it runs from the correct user.

ticket.description: The user won't know why the send button isn't activated because there's no feedback to the user. We need a slightly better way to let the user understand what (s)he needs to do.
ticket.summary: Usability: When trying to click send, user is never warned the email is missing

ticket.description:
Copied from the version 1.6 known issue list. This seems to still be a problem in version 2.0.
On the "Guest Voucher" page, if one starts to type a recipient email address and then clicks on the "Delete" button, the warning "Invalid or missing email" appears and the "Delete" button is highlighted, but the voucher does not delete (reported by Wendy). If one (without changing anything) then clicks on the "Delete" button again the confirmation dialog appears, then clicking "Yes" deletes the voucher and clears/reloads the page (noted by Xander).
ticket.summary: Guest Voucher manual deletion interrupted if "invalid or missing email" warning triggered

ticket.description:
May be related to #1270. When the config looks like this: 

$config['terasender_enabled'] = true; // true/false
$config['terasender_advanced'] =  true; // true/false - terasender advanced - show advanced settings
$config['terasender_chunk_size'] = 5 * 1024 * 1024;        // default (5) terasender chunk size
$config['terasender_worker_count'] = 30;        // default (6) worker count
$config['terasender_start_mode'] = 'multiple'; // "single" to start all workers on the first file, "multiple" to dispatch them on all files
Uploads of small files fail. I tried with a file of 329 bytes. Trial and error showed me that uploading would succeed when using at most 20 workers, 21 and more fail. When uploading fails, the file appears green just as it should and the logs show that upload succeeded, just as it should, but the UI hangs there. Refreshing the page shows that uploading failed and offers to try again, with the same result. Changing the chunk size didn't seem to make any difference. Logs are included *Successful upload with 20 workers*

[2016-02-05 11:40:22] [rest:info] [user USERNAME] File#7 (FILENAME, 329 bytes) added to Transfer#7
[2016-02-05 11:40:22] [rest:info] [user USERNAME] Recipient#7 (EMAIL) added to Transfer#7

ticket.summary: Terasender fails on small files

ticket.description:
Clone from ticket #999. Need to check what happens when in current 2.0-alpha the file suddenly no longer can be read (for example because it was deleted by the user while uploading).
For details see related (original) ticket #999.
Required for both HTML5 and Tera Sender.
Scenario: start large file upload from USB disk, USB disk unplugges, HTML5 upload script can no longer read file, and upload hangs.
What probably shoudl happen is that when the next chunk of file being uploaded can't be read, after a certain timeout a dialogue ought to pop up "having trouble reading file, cancel upload yes/no?" and maybe even include a "should I try to resume" question. At the very least the user needs to be made aware of the possibility to resume. Most people won't know this and especially for larger files it would be .... annoying.
ticket.summary: Error message required when HTML5/Terasender upload javascript can no longer read file

ticket.description: We keep running into problems with especially large uploads (100s of GB), using specific browsers (IE 11) or boundary conditions (25+ workers). We need to: - document TeraSender functionality: implementation, design, flow - analyse whether this is good enough - change where needed
ticket.summary: Thorough analysis + documentation of TeraSender upload module in 2.0

ticket.description:
The current QWA MyFiles shows the dates for when a file was downloaded. A feature request came in on the feature request forum, by James M: https://filesender.uservoice.com/admin/users/32753502-james-m
It sounds like a good idea to enable this. It would fit best in the new MyFiles, the one from QWA. We already have a list of the dates a file is downloaded on, in the expanded view. The IP address is stored in the database. So all we need is: -to display the ip address next to the download date, show ipv4 or ipv6 address -implement a config.php switch "show download user ip address in myfiles" to either show or not show download ip addresses in MyFiles
We'll start with IP address, but would be good to have a look at whether resolving the ip address makes sense. It is a bit tricky, as we don't store the resolving result in the database, so would mean "live" resolving resulting in possible slower display of MyFiles, not preferable. Now that I write this, it sounds like a bad idea to do resolving live. Might be a nice phase2 change for this functionality, with database change to store resolving result "on download".
ticket.summary: add option to MyFiles: show which IP address downloaded a file
Make sure invitation voucher upload must *also* always be sent to invitation voucher creator

ticket.description:
The voucher issuer can select an option by which the voucher receiver can only sent the file to voucher issuer, i.e. "To:" = e-mail address of voucher issuer.
An implementation question is whether this is a side-wide decision or a per-voucher-issuer decision.
1. make it a side-wide decision. A server admin can decide to switch this on, or off. On means upload invitations can only be used to upload a file to the originator of the invitation. Off means uploads can be sent to anyone
2. make it a possible choice for the originator of an invitation. Allow them to tick this as an option when creating an upload invitation. The option might be ticked by default, or not (another config option).
If you have a fairly constrained use case (for example to provide a "dump your multi-GB error trace files here" facility to customers of a machine) the first option would fit the bill.
If you'd like to make this the general default but would like to offer users the option to divert (for example: research collaboration of 4 people, of which one (A) has access to a filesender instance, wanting to enable persons B and C to send a file directly) from the default, we'd need option (2) as well.
Implementation ought to start with option (1), and then proceed with option (2). Option (2) has UI consequences.
ticket.summary: limit file upload recipient to voucher creator [M]
show remaining dates from previous month in date picker

ticket.description:
implement auto-refresh after click on download in MyTransfers.
This ticket is a clone from ticket #984, remaining work from version 1.6.
When a user downloads a file via the My Transfer table entry, the download counters do not get incremented until the page is refreshed. In version 1.6 we did not have a reliable way to detect whether a download was complete or cancelled. In 2.0 we can detect up to all but the last chunk whether a download was successfull.
We create an event in the audit trail log for "Recipient X finished downloading <file> (size)" on when sending the last chunk of a download (Etienne, that is correct, right?).
That means we make an assumption in the audit log that afer the last download chuk is sent the file was downloaded. We may as well refresh the my transfer page when that event occurs in the download case of downloading via my transfers.
ticket.summary: implement auto-refresh after click on download from My Transfers table

ticket.description:
purpose for this ticket: we need to sum up arguments for and against and figure out how on-first-logon can be implemented. Document this, then make a decision: implement or not.
Idea Chris and Vegard:Set AuP ticked bit in every transaction and just re-use value from the last transaction. We assume AuP tick is valid until AuP changes. Re-enforcing AuP (and forcing user to tick again) means having a re-enforcment AuP date config option. On that date every user AuP tick is "reset".
ticket.summary: Move AuP to be on-first-logon rather then on-every-session

ticket.description:

setting $config['ban_extension'] to '' (= empty string) or null should allow all extensions, including 'no' extension. However the current code takes it too literally and will prevent the sending of files without extension. So the following files will be marked as 'invalid':
empty-extension. no-extension
As noticed by MeRC on the AARNet Cloudstor install and reported by Wendy.
ticket.summary: Bug from prev. release: Empty/null $config['ban_extension'] prevents sending files with no extension

ticket.description:
Experience shows a transfer limit of 30 files is not enough. We need a better reasonable default. We need to assess whether there is a reason this can't be unlimited.
Practical limits: - table of contents in download zip file of 2^64 files (64 bit offset) - maximum number of records in SQL table -most likely a practical limit in the file selection box, probably "over a few 1000" because we would be creating a lot of HTML nodes. The page would be sloooooow.
Probably not a problem to setting it to 2000, over that may have implications for memory use.
We will configure a default file limit of 2000 per transfer
ticket.summary: Reconsider default limit on #files per transfer

Regarding filesizes: we should be consistent with what operating systems present to users. And then it's GB and MB Regarding transfer speed: double-check whether it displays Mbit/s or Mbyte/s. If it does Mbyte/s the 2nd character (MB/s or GB/s) should be a capital.

ticket.description:
Create a script that sends a summary of key statistics (e.g. numbers of users, upload, downloads, active files and a comparison to previous month) by email to the site admin. Should be institution specific in cases where such information is included with user credentials (will need an additional logs table field).
Could be done as an optional cron job. Storing parsed data in an additional DB table specifically for this purpose might be best, although all stats can be retrieved from the logs table.
Input Xander: if org-attribuut then instelling = org-attribuut else instelling = domein authuseremail
Implement stats both as email and once queries are settled, implement as "stats" tab.
About access control: lets start with what we concluded in the stats module but without the "user". $config['stats_access_level'] = 'statsadmin'; // Who can access stats page. Possible settings are 'statsadmin', 'public' or 'disabled'. A more restrictive setting here would override the access settings below.
To start with the key stats from the stats module are probably useful. Would be wonderful to have those key stats both per filesender instans and per institution. Would also be helpful to be able to indicate different timeperiods (up to 10?) you'd like to see next to eachother for easy comparison, for example key stats for 2010-2013, or for march 2012 vs. march 2013, especially when thinking of visiting institutions for marketing purposes etc.
*Note: we do need to discuss the need for anonimisation/aggregation: do we already do this for a simple stats function in 2.0 "asap" or would we postpone it to after we have the key numbers?* First thought: let us focus on making key numbers per instans and site available ASAP, based on current database tables. Phase 2: once key stats have stabilised, work out proper way for anonimisation and aggregation, possibly prepared for phase 3: allow sending aggregates/anonimised stats to centralised collector. Phase 4: pretty pictures.
ticket.summary: Script to send a stats summary by email to site admin

ticket.description: The email advising that a file has been downloaded is generated when one clicks on the "Start Download" button, not when the download finishes. This give the impression that a recipient has downloaded the file, even if they clicked on "Cancel" rather than "Save File" when prompted. This could result in the uploader prematurely manually deleting an uploaded file, thinking that their recipient has already downloaded it.
ticket.summary: Download email generated even if user clicks on "Cancel" rather than "Save File"

ticket.description:
When using international characters in filenames other than ISO-8859-1 the filename will look 'funny' when downloaded with Internet Explorer and possibly other browsers other than FireFox, Chrome or Safari. The file is however correctly downloaded and usable.
The "Content-Dispositon" problem
At the moment the labeling of a string as UTF-8 encoded is not done when a file containing special characters is downloaded. The download process uses the HTTP Content-Disposition header with a filename parameter. This header is only defined for filenames containing characters from the (single byte) ISO-8859-1 character set.
Although there are currently ongoing standardisation efforts to make it possible to use other character sets there is no universally adopted way of transmitting a UTF-8 encoded filename yet (see http://greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/draft-ietf-httpbis-content-disp-latest.html for details). The current filesender code therefore relies on what is called 'encoding sniffing' in browsers such as FireFox, Chrome and Safari. Internet Explorer can only handle ISO-8859-1 (single byte) encoded filenames.
See our developer documentation on International_Character_Handling
ticket.summary: Filename with international characters other than ISO-8859-1 will look 'funny' when downloaded with IE

ticket.description:
On (at least) Mac OSX filenames with certain Unicode characters tend to be represented as 'decomposed unicode' (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode_equivalence for an explanation). Although FileSender transparantly handles those decomposed characters and leaves the actual handling to the browser and OS it looks like most notably Windows (when storing a file with 'decomposed unicode' characters from FireFox/Chrome) and IE11 (when displaying those files in My Files or a download page) doesn't handle those characters as expected.
We might consider 'fixing' this in FileSender by normalizing 'decomposed unicode' to 'precomposed unicode'.
Considerations: - The normalizer_normalize function of the PHP intl extension can be used for this, this requires PHP 5.3+ and adds extra dependencies (php5-intl, libicu) - Should we normalize when uploading (before storing the filename into the database) or only when displaying/downloading?
This ticket was cloned from the 1.6 milestone: we need to check whether this is still an issue with the current 2.0 code and if it is, whether we can resolve it.
ticket.summary: Handling decomposed unicode in filenames

If no: we need to remove that functionality from the Transfer overview table for the Admin.

ticket.description:
The nested table layout in files.php causes a lot of database queries to be made, particularly related to calculating number of downloads per file / per user. This scales poorly as the numbers of transactions, recipients and files increase. Many of the calculations can be performed in PHP code (or pre-calculated with the help of ticket #1014).
As suggested by Chris, it would also help to only load the basic "top-level" data necessary to display the main table on page load, and use AJAX to load the details if/when the user expands a table row.
ticket.summary: Reduce number of DB queries made on page load in files.php

ticket.description:
When an Authenticated user is uploading a files/s and authentication is lost/logged out the console returns ErrorAuth but user is not notified.
To reproduce: Logon to Filesender Open 2 browser tabs Start a large file upload in one browser tab While upload is progressing - logout in the other tab Uploading tab hangs without notifying user.
This same issue will happen if SAML times out during a very long upload.
Need to notify user that they are no longer Authenticated. Additionally in 1.6 we tested code to allow the upload to complete to prevent frustration with extremely long file uploads. But then valid sessions were the next issue.
See ticket #905
ticket.summary: ErrorAuth on Upload when Auth is lost

ticket.description:
Reported by Lubos Kopecky.
IE shows me error:
Webpage error details
User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; Trident/4.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C) Timestamp: Mon, 10 Feb 2014 21:23:12 UTC
Message: Object doesn't support this property or method Line: 649 Char: 1 Code: 0
Relates to addEventListener not a function in IE - needs to detect if addEventListener is available or replace with attachEvent.This is an IE specific issue.
Code below: window.addEventListener('keydown', function(e) {(e.keyCode == 27 && e.preventDefault())})
Fix: Replace with. if (window.addEventListener){ window.addEventListener('keydown', function(e) {(e.keyCode == 27 && e.preventDefault())}) } else if (window.attachEvent){ window.attachEvent('onkeydown', function(e) {(e.keyCode == 27 && e.preventDefault())}) }
ticket.summary: Javascript errors when using IE

ticket.description:
I managed to trip this one by configuring Norwegian as the only language in locale.php while that's not set as the default language
The GUI says "Configuration error(s), please check the server logs or ask an admin to do so." while the Apache server log says "Sep 17 10:42:15 terasender apache2: ConfigValidator "default_language" does not validate check : default_language must be one of the available languages defined in locale.php (no)".
There is no logging in the FileSender log. Where do messages from the ConfigValidator go? If they always go to "wherever PHP logs" we need to state "check your PHP server logs" in this error.
Another consideration: we state that the hard coded language of last resort is always "en". However, in this case that is not true. So either I need to change the language config documentation or we need to change this from a fatal error to a (severe) warning?
ticket.summary: Bug: unclear error on tripping the default language config validation + inconsistent documentation/reality

Credit to Jan for pointing this one out:
A 64-bit version of PHP is required for much of FileSender to work properly, but this is not currently being checked anywhere in the code. An error message (similar to what happens if config.php is not found) should be generated if the PHP installation is found to be 32-bit aware only.
See http://stackoverflow.com/a/6304354 for one possible way to perform such a check.

ticket.description:
Go from three to two of which only one is mandatory to make autocomplete work.
Situation now:
three parameters.
autocomplete = true autocomplete_max_shown = max_stored_frequent_recipients =
If you do not specify the last one it won't work as it won't gather any records.
Proposed future situation with two parameters
autocomplete: -false/0: no autocomplete -number: number of items returned by search -by default if no other parameter set, use 5xnumber for stored items -if that does not work for your instance (users use lots of different recipients) use second parameter which will override 5 times value
autocomplete_max_pool: how many recipients to store in user preferences.
ticket.summary: Simplify autocomplete configuration parameters

ticket.description:
Required for both HTML5 and Tera Sender.
Scenario: start large file upload from USB disk, USB disk unplugges, HTML5 upload script can no longer read file, and upload hangs.
What probably shoudl happen is that when the next chunk of file being uploaded can't be read, after a certain timeout a dialogue ought to pop up "having trouble reading file, cancel upload yes/no?" and maybe even include a "should I try to resume" question. At the very least the user needs to be made aware of the possibility to resume. Most people won't know this and especially for larger files it would be .... annoying.
ticket.summary: Error message required when HTML5/Terasender upload javascript can no longer read file

ticket.description:
The config variable email_return_path specifies where email bounces will be sent to.
If this variable is not set, bounces will arrive at the sender. If this varialbe is set to an email address that can receive emails then the script scripts/task/emailfeedback.php can be used to process bounces. If VRRP (?) is used even if the bounce message is non-standard we can see something happened. This introduces a variable in the email headers (?)
Verify more tomorrow with Etienne.
ticket.summary: Documentation 2.0: how to configure bounce handling
Remove logo and title to allow individual branding

ticket.description:
When leaving multiupload.php after filling in the form and then coming back to it (using the browser's back button), the "files to upload" box is messed up. See attached screenshot for example. jQuery also throws an error: "Uncaught Error: cannot call methods on button prior to initialization; attempted to call method 'enable' ".
Cases to think about:
* Pressing "Back" after successfully uploading a file: the form should be cleared. * Closing and reopening the tab/browser to the same page: the form should remember its contents. * Going to a different page and then back to multiupload.php (or accidentally hitting the back button while on multiupload.php): the form should remember it's contents.
ticket.summary: Browser back button page load behaviours

This give the impression that a recipient has downloaded the file, even if they clicked on "Cancel" rather than "Save File" when prompted. This could result in the uploader prematurely manually deleting an uploaded file, thinking that their recipient has already downloaded it.
ticket.summary: Download email generated even if user clicks on "Cancel" rather than "Save File"

ticket.description:
Test platform terasender.uninett.no/branches/filesender2.0/ is based on Debian with Exim as MTA. Test platform filesender.uninett.no/beta is based on red hat + postfix as MTA.
terasender platform sends out emails that are displayed correctly at client. Emails sent from uninett.no/beta are displayed "raw", mangled. Differences in headers:
========= Good email:
--mbnd--alt--1440662171464055dec29b93c0e Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"; format=flowed Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Bad email:
--mbnd--alt--1440520233238455dc982937416 Content-Type: text/plain
Content-Type:text/plain; charset="utf-8"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
=========
Not encoding the mail as quoted printable by changing utils/Mail.class.php seems to help:
// Encode contents // $plain = quoted_printable_encode($plain);
Etienne thinks: mime headers are not being considered by mail client because somehow a double carriage return is introduced. So quoted printable header is not being interpreted as a header. Then you get garbled header. What introduces double carriage returns in stead of single ones as we set in FileSender.
For some reason the outgoing SMTP server might be using old LF character (single \n rather than \r\n). This can be tested easily.
Modify file classes/constants GlobalConstants.class.php and remove \r.
If this now works it means SMTP server doesn't use \r\n for new lines, perhaps replaces \r by \n.
Jan to ask Thierry to test this on filesender.uninett.no/beta.
ticket.summary: Email formatting sometimes broken: raw email formatting displayed rather than pretty formatted

This needs to be a configurable option: "no_download_cc = yes/no"

ticket.description:
Currently there are some differences in layout/button placement/workflow between the Flash and HTLM5 versions of the New Upload screen (which gives us the opportunity to make a choice about which one is nicer ;-)
1) Fresh screen (no file selected yet): Flash: "Browse" button HTLM5: "Choose file" button + "No file chosen" text in a box followed by a "Upload" button to the right
2) After selecting a file: Flash: "Browse" and "Upload" button followed by name and size below the buttons HTML5: "Choose file" button + "<filename>" text in a box followed by a "Upload" button to the right *and* followed by name, size *and* MIME-type below the buttons
2) After pressing Upload
Flash: "Browse" button locked (grayed out), Upload button becomes "Cancel" button, name and size stays the same and is followed by a nice green progress bar below HTML5: The "Choose file"/upload block is replaced by a single "Cancel" button, name, size and mime type stays the same and is (after a while!) followed by the nice green progress bar.
I somehow like the Flash variant ;-)
Things that might be relevant:
Browsers used: FF 3.6.19 on OSX 10.5.8 for Flash, Chrome 13.xxx on OSX 10.5.8 for HTML5. Server version 1.5 Beta Revision: 741 on filesender.surfnet.nl/proto/
ticket.summary: Make "New Upload" screen consistent between Flash and HTML5 variants

ticket.description:
1.5 adds multiple database backend support (the DBAL code). Initially the configuration was implemented with a single URL-style dsn parameter. For various reasons it was decided to implement this slightly different to both ease packaging and make the upgrade path (from 1.0.1 to 1.5) a bit 'safer'.
In config.php (as distributed): replace all pg_* settings with db_* settings (make the prefix db-independent) and add a db_type parameter
In the code (DBAL.php): check the config settings according to the following flow:
1) check if dsn is defined/set 2) check if db_* parameters + db_type are defined/set 3) check pg_* parameters are defined/set 4) error
For cases 2) and 3) construct a dsn (with possible defaults like host and port if not explicitly set)
This will cater for the case were people still use the 'old' pg_* style settings, will introduce a similar (as in 1.0.1) but more flexible config (db_*) and also allows setting a single dsn for new db-types which need more than the generic db_* settings.
ticket.summary: New and upgrade-proof configuration of database parameters

ticket.description:
Behaviour: after logging on a user is simply redirected to the logon page. Logging of SimpleSAMLphp seems to indicate the user is not logged on, no authenticated session is created.
FileSender 2.0 explicitly sets the session.cookie.path to the site URL on initialisation. Usually this points to / and won't cause any issues for the standard setup with simplesamlphp where simplesamlphp is in a separate URL space from FileSender.
However, on my testing machine and for example for launching our filesender.uninett.no/beta service this is a bit different and hence sessions between simplesamlphp and filesender are not accepted by filesender. With Shibboleth this is not an issue as it uses its own session variable handling. SimpleSAMLphp is in php and shares with PHP.
Agreed solution: introduce a configuration parameter session_cookie_path. When using SimpleSAMLphp in a URL path other than /, you need to configure this to for example /.
If the parameter is not set, FileSender uses the default application path which is either specified in site_url or extracted from the application environment.
ticket.summary: Logon problem with SimpleSAMLphp in different URL space (session.cookie.path)

ticket.description:
Submitted by Thijs Kinkhorst
Within our organisation there was the desire that files get not simply unlinked when they are expired but are wiped from disk by overwriting them with random data. This tries to combat the effect of filesender's filestore becoming a goldmine of assorted documents that would be easy to recover - somewhat like the infamous printer hard drives.
Attached patch implements this. The wiping happens at night, so I think usually it will not matter much that it takes a little bit longer than unlinking. I did add a configurable option for it, for sites that don't want this functionality; the default is set to true now because I reasoned that it normally doesn't hurt, and there will probably only be a few sites for which it's necessary to turn it off. Still, I can imagine that you want to pick another default for this.
It makes use of GNU coreutils shred, which I think can safely be assumed to be available given the "Linux" requirement of filesender.
ticket.summary: Shred files to completey remove them when deleted
Add/Update Croatian language

ticket.description:
Currently a number of config options are set by default. This allows installs to work with a very limited config file but has the disadvantage of "hiding" functionality: stuff just works magically.
We need to decide on: - what the default set of functionality (and thus config directives) should be - whether this should be defined in "hidden" defaults - or whether this should be defined in a sample config file
We need to decide this before the beta, because otherwise an update might break deployed installations.
ticket.summary: Decide on dropping or keeping config defaults

ticket.description:
When I use an IE 10 with compatibility view activated I can't choose date and neither choose a file. Is it a known bug? Reported by Iñigo Rodriguez.
Looks like it may be an IE10 Compatibility mode browser issue.
https://connect.microsoft.com/IE/feedback/details/774078
http://bugs.jquery.com/ticket/12577
IE 10 compativility mode causes a "SCRIPT3: Member not found" script error which stops all scripts.
Without being able to fix the issue in IE we can add <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge"> to the head of index.php and this will force IE to not use compativility mode. Stops the issue happening if someone tries to use IE10-Compatibility mode.
Doesn’t solve the issue of what is really causing the problem which seems to be a browser issue.
ticket.summary: IE 10 Compatibility mode script error

Pressing the actual 'Close' button does what is expected, it closes the dialog box and it is still possible to 'restart' the upload by pressing Send.
ticket.summary: Crypto: fix or disable 'esc'/[x] dialog actions for password dialogs (up/down)

ticket.description:
After considering the filename issue that popped out of the 1st security audit (ticket #1173) Etienne wonders about another possible issue: using template code in file names.
As with any other user data we run filenames through html_entities before displaying. XSS injection and such should be fine. But we are not running it through template code protection. An attacker might be able to upload file with a filename containing template compatible code {cfg:databaseword} and do Wrong Stuff like displaying the database password. Measures to protect against this were implemented in the web interface but not in emails, including the user message.
Etienne will check whether this is an issue and if needed fix it
ticket.summary: Security: check for possible attack using template code in file names

ticket.description:
*Issue:* _vulnerability, not directly exploitable_: in most parts of the cost weak comparison is used. PHP will try to guess the type of variable on both sides and when possible will make an integer comparison (php default) which in some situations could lead to bypassing certain filter or check. If comparing two strings where first string is very large number and second string is also very large number then php will think they are alike. Lets convert it to integer and make comparison. Recommendation: always use strict comparison.
*Assessment:* oops.
*Response:* will fix.
ticket.summary: Security audit: 2.14.5: Usage of PHP weak comparison

ticket.description:
*Issue:* _defence in depth:_ the "variable variables" technique is used in the template parser where variables are dynamically created. This may lead to a situation where a user can overwrite any variable in the current symbol table like a path variable and include a php script controlled by the user like a php script included in a URL. At the moment this is not exploitable as the user doesn't control the keys that are provided with the vars parameter. In future versions this might change.
Pine recommends to switch to a different mechanism like a key/value store.
*Assessment:* This is currently not a problem as there is no flow that allows a user to call the template method. Implementing a key/value store approach makes writing templates heavier. For the time being we will keep this as it is and gather practical experience with the template mechanism.
Details: In the template class there's a method that when called renders a template. This method looks for a template, resolves the template path (is it in the config directory because it's a customised template or is it in the default template directory?). Then it includes that template file if found while creating on the fly a set of varilables that the template will use. The method is given an associated array of key-value pairs (foo=bar) and creates variables for use in the template with name 'foo' and value 'bar'. . It could become
issue confirmed and needs to be addressed. Using a key/value store approach makes writing templates heavier. Hesitating between rewrite using some kind of keystore or filtering given variables before creating variables so they don't contain unexpected stuff like globals etc., path variable. The latter approach is error-prone, every time we introduce variable we also need to update the filter.
When rendering for example a report at end of upload, the template process method with template name "report" can have a variable report=array of report objects. In template code this then allows for a construct like "foreach $report as report do ....".
This mechanism is to make for easier template writing. It is currently not directly exploitable and needs significant other bad programming practice to make this exploitable.
A possible future exploit: if at some point user input is fed directly to the template processing function, it could give a set of variables that could have post data.
*Response:* this is not exploitable and needs significant bad programming practice to make it exploitable. We will gain practical experience with the template mechanism to see if the balance ease of use vs. security in depth needs to be different in future versions.
ticket.summary: Security audit 1: 2.14.4: Usage of variable variables

ticket.description:
*Issue:* _defence in depth:_ when an exception occurs a user is redirected to a page with a serialised array containing information about the exception. This array is unserialised and used to generate an exception object. User input can be used when serialising and unserialising arrays. A user can also give the application an object in this way; the application will happily unserialise object upon which the PHP interpreter will automatically call several functions on that object, e.g. wakeup, destruct, etc. This has an unknown impact on application. At the moment this can not be exploited but it might be exploitable in future FileSender versions. For defense-in-depth this should be addressed.
*Assessment:* issue confirmed. This can not be exploited now as there is no code like wakeup or destruct that does anything when called but this might become a problem in the future. This will be addressed by using JSON. Daan agrees this is a good solution.
*Response:* json serialisation will be used to avoid potential code injection when using native serialise/unserialise.
ticket.summary: Security audit 1: 2.14.2: PHP object injection

ticket.description:
*Issue:* _vulnerability:_ there is no protection against click-jacking nor do we mention clickjacking as a risk anywhere in the installation documentation. Recommendation is to set the x-frame-header in each request or same-origin, allow-from in the webserver config and/or document in the manual what to do if iframes are allowed. Either we document the risks with using iframes or ensure they can't be used.
*Assessment*: this is both a risk and a feature. Integrating FileSender using an iframe is a feature. Should you want to limit inclusion of FileSender in iframes, preliminary investigation suggests W3C's candidate recommendation Content Security Policy (CSP, http://www.w3.org/TR/CSP2/) is the standards-based way to do this. According to http://caniuse.com/#feat=contentsecuritypolicy this is supported on most currrent browsers. IE11 is supported by adding X-Content-Security-Policy. Daan suggests to set the same-origin header in the Apache config.
*Response*: as this is both a feature and a vulnerability we will not enforce this in the FileSender application. We will use CSP to allow for fine-grained protection. Rather than implement a swath of config options in FileSender we will document how to configure CSP in Apache for use with FileSender to prevent inclusion in iframes.
ticket.summary: Security audit 1: 2.11.8: Anti-clickjacking measures must be implemented

ticket.description:
This allows to interrupt the service for database upgrade or even server restart without breaking uploads.
When switched on:
- all pages are replaced with the maintenance page - webservice returns specific exception to all requests - clients display a popup explaining what happens - clients pause uploads and put all requests they were about to make in a stack - clients starts to query the server on a regular basis to see if maintenance ended (server responding with no exception status) - when server exits maintenance mode clients restart uploading and run stacked requests and remove maintenance popup
Implemented in changeset [[3431]] and [[r:3534]]
Config directive is config parameter "maintenance" that is boolean and false by default.
ticket.summary: Feature: maintenance mode

ticket.description:
The ZIP files produced by Zipper.php don't currently work with the Mac OS X Archive Utility. Depending on the value of the "version needed to extract" header that is sent with the file, one of two behaviours occurs:
* The .zip file unzips to a .cpgz file, which unzips to a .zip file, which unzips to a .cpgz file, and so on (see [[url:http://linlog.skepticats.com/entries/2012/02/Streaming_ZIP_files_in_PHP.php|here]]). * An error message is produced: _Error 2: No such file or directory_
The unzip terminal command appears to work without reporting any errors.
We also need to test the files with other common clients. In Windows 7 (x64), both the default Windows Explorer utility and WinRAR are able to handle the files. In Ubuntu 13.04 (x64), the unzip terminal command works fine.
ticket.summary: Ensure ZIP files work with most common clients

ticket.description:
*Issue:* _vulnerability without accessible attack surface:_ there is one single case of javascript injection where not all outputs are escaped; the code allows for specification of a REST API callback handler for iframe integration. Currently the user doesn't have any control over all inputs but might have this in future versions.
*Assessment:* this is considered part of a feature which enables an application integrator to give return data to a handler of your choice idea is you give return data to handler of your choice. Being able to point to an existing function or object method from a parent window is to be expected.
*Response:* during the discussion of the issue Etienne suggested to limit what you can give as callback. Letters, digits, dash and underscores. This addresses the issue. Daan confirms.
ticket.summary: Security audit 1: 2.7.7: User input must be encoded before it is used in HTML output

ticket.description:
*Issue*: _defence in depth, no vulnerability_. Nearly all SQL commands are done using prepared statements but Daan found a number of places where variables were used in SQL commands. The end user currently has no control over the contents of those variables but this might happen in future services. As a general rule we should use prepared statements, don't trust input. If we don't use prepared statements use some kind of escaping. Cast it to an int or add escaping before printing it to a variable.
*Assessment*: we use prepared statements where we can but prepared statements don't support "in" statements.
*Response*: Etienne will investigate whether he can construct a function that prepares a prepared statement.
ticket.summary: Security audit 1: 2.7.4 User input must be encoded before it is used in SQL commands

ticket.description:
The checkFileSize() function in [[url:https://www.assembla.com/code/file_sender/subversion/nodes/2289/filesender/playground/filesender-1.5-multiupload-3/www/fs_multi_upload.php#ln453|fs_multi_upload.php]] and [[url:https://www.assembla.com/code/file_sender/subversion/nodes/2289/filesender/playground/filesender-1.5-multiupload-3/www/fs_upload.php#ln441|fs_upload.php]] accounts for different server OSs by calling different shell commands depending on the value of PHP_OS. It should be possible to simplify this code by using PHP's [[url:http://php.net/manual/en/function.stat.php|stat()]] instead.
Chris informs me that it was done this way to circumvent issues with the stat() function returning negative size numbers on files larger than 2 GB on 32-bit operating systems. This should no longer be a problem since 64-bit Linux and 64bits aware PHP are now part of the Filesender server requirements.
ticket.summary: Stat command in checkFileSize()

ticket.description:
*Issue:* defence in depth: filenames were not escaped when used in a certain piece of code. This was not an actual vulnerability as in the offending code it wasn't user supplied input but the overall security of the software would improve by ensuring escaped filenames, just in case the piece of code might be called in the future with user-supplied input.
As a general recommendation: don't rely on input, and when handling input don't rely on the difference between user input and application input as roles might changes in future code.
*Assessment:* the recommendation is sound. In this particular case the offending code no longer exists.
*Response:* none needed
ticket.summary: Security audit 1: 2.7.3: User input must be encoded before it is used in path/filenames

ticket.description:
*Issue:* _defence in depth:_ when FileSender receives user input the function sanitizeInput is used to ensure the input will not contain anything that will be executed. This function currently filters the input for a number of dangerous characters and adds a space to them. Pine recommends to use escaping, the current code uses filtering.
Filtering changes the input and might lead to unexpected side-effects.
*Assessment*: Etienne's collegues in the Sympa mailinglist software project had a security audit executed where an issue was found using variable encoded string injection. The offending string had to be machine-generated. This string defeated perls regexp-based entity encoding mechanism. The php mechanism behaved the same. Sympa introduced a filtering fix which was reported in this FileSender audit. The filtering fix was based on a blog-article published on OWASP as a recommendation. Unfortunately the blog article is now no longer accessible.
Daan indicated he's unaware of any technique to bypass html_entities. He tested by removing the line of code and injection of code was not possible. The strong recommendation is to not filter on input; you don't know where the data will be used.
*Response:* there is not yet consensus in the FileSender core team on the best approach. Based on the experience of the Sympa mailinglist software team escaping alone might not be enough. The issue found in the Sympa security audit might now have been fixed and the filtering fix no longer needed. We will await the results of the 2nd security audit and then decide what to do. We will address this before the 2.0 release.
ticket.summary: Securit audit 1: 2.7.1: User input must be encoded in the context where it is used

ticket.description:
I felt the need to have the possibility to force a user to accept an AuP. From a user's perspective the nicest is to do that once and never again. Easiest to implement at this point in time is to force a user to accept the AuP every time.
What we'll implement for Beta-1.10 is:
underneath the 'file' button a checkbox with label "I accept the terms and conditions of this service", the checkbox next to it, and listbox with text of AuP next to that. 4/5 lines high.
A big 'Send' button underneath that. Send button as big as 'Message' box is at the moment.
Make it mandatory to tick the box before you can upload. Check both client side and server side.
Further discussion with Guido later today lead to the belief that this feature should be configurable. As in: -a configurable switch 'AuP' = true/false
combined with
-a configurable swith 'AuP_Default_Set'=true/false
The feature will be available in Beta-1.10:
ticket.summary: Configurable AuP checkbox in Flash UI

ticket.description:
*Issue:* vulnerability: FileSender uses random numbers and identifiers in various places, for example in the download URL. The reviewd 2.0 codebase uses uniq_id and mt_rand. Both don't return a sufficiently secure random number which may result in an attacker guessing the state of the random generator. An attacker might thus be able to guess download URLs and CSRF tokens. Recommend to use secure random generator.
*Assessment:* Issue confirmed and needs to be addressed before the 2.0 release. Preferably without using openssl as it would add a dependency and be about 100 times (ballpark figure) slower than using the other random generator.
The unique identifiers used in FileSender need to have two characteristics: • the ID must be unique • the ID must be non-guessable. As long as you can't guess the random number in the ID you can't guess the random generator state.
For the FileUID we check uniqueness, if a collision occurs we generate a new one. To make the ID non-guessable Pine recommends a HMAC. The recommendation is to use a secure random number generator like openssl but using for example /dev/urandom or mtrand and hash that combined with a salt value to an HMAC is sufficiently secure. FileSender would need to auto-generate the salt value.
Pine comments that wile an attacker in this way won't be able to directly know the random number you have to be very careful you don't leak random number to user somewhere.
*Response:* Etienne will add HMAC with a random generated salt and look at making it configurable to read urandom or use mt_rand.
ticket.summary: Security audit 1: 2.6.13: Generated passwords and tokens must not be predictable

ticket.description:
Symptom: the upload succeeds, mails are sent, but there is still an error both to user + in the logs on server side.
Upload of a 5GB file on terasender.uninett.no/branches/filesender-2.0/ The upload was with Safari. That instance is now configured with 6 webworkers. I did the upload over the WLAN.
A couple of times the message was displayed "slower than usual, try again, quit etc.". I clicked try again, it hopped a bit back in progress and the progressed.
At the end, the progress bar indicated the upload was complete, I got the download email, and I got an error (enclosed in this mail) that there was a problem.
In the logs server side I can see there's a problem logged.
On disk the file appears to be all there: -rw-r--r-- 1 www-data www-data 5368710144 Feb 9 11:35 397b17f7-bccf-a1d8-c600-41d72a7ca092
It also downloads again: -rw-r--r--@ 1 meijer staff 5368710144 Feb 9 11:18 testfile-5GB+1byte-2.dat
Etienne's analysis:
* When last worker finishes: triggers file complete request. When all files are complete, transfer complete request is sent. Normally triggers mail sending etc. * After this transfer complete request was sent another chunk was sent. The webservice doesn’t accept chunks after a transfer complete is sent. the client should NOT send chunks after transfer complete. * this MAY happen in one case only, with the automatic restart of stalled transfers. * There are TWO automatic restarts of a transfer before asking whether a transfer should restart so a user won't see if a transfer restarts only once
There might be a situation where the transfer is both complete and restarted. Etienne will add more logging to see if restarts have an unfortunate timing.
This is a bug we need to fix.
ticket.summary: A chunk was sent after transfer complete resulting in an error
Document $config['stalling_detection']
