ticket.description:
Hi,
I would like to strongly suggest to change the official installation [1] manuals to NOT include generating of a self-signed certificate since Flash only works with self-signed certificates in Internet Explorer and results in famous Flash 2038 IO Error when trying to upload a file using all non-IE browsers (both Linux and Windows). It seems to be a Flash issue [2], but it is rather hard to figure it out from very generic "#2038 IO Error" message code. I know that the instructions say: "Be sure to get a real certificate since filesender won't work with snakeoil certificates." but if these steps are not valid and must be replaced (with fairly different steps), why to include them in the first place?
We have spent a considerable amount of time to track this down so it maybe worth to include the "2038 error" in the related FAQ [3] for people getting the error not realizing it works with http.
Cheers Jiri Horky
[1] http://www.assembla.com/spaces/file_sender/wiki/Installation_-_Debian_Ubuntu [2] http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/FP-201 [3] http://www.assembla.com/wiki/show/file_sender/FAQ#71202d207369746520776f726b732077697468206874747020627574206e6f7420776974682068747470732c20756e636c656172206572726f72732e
ticket.summary: Self-signed certificates problems vs official documentation

ticket.description:

I think it would be nice to change it in some future release to more suitable integer types that would save some space (-->speed increase) and it would be also easier and faster to to some statistics (e.g. group by netmask).
Jiri Horky
ticket.summary: inefficient ipv4 and ipv6 data types in database

ticket.description: When clicking for example "help" or "about" in FileSender 1.5, a dialogue box pops up. This box needs to be explicitly closed before a user can return to a "useful" FileSender 1.5 window again. To facilitate easy closing of this dialogue box it would be helpful to put the focus on the "close" button when opening this dialogue box, such that a "space" or "enter" results in box closure and a user doesn't necessarily have to move his mouse pointer. This would be the same for any dialogue box that is opened in FileSender 1.5
ticket.summary: Put "focus" on "close" button in dialogue popups

ticket.description:
1. I suggest to move the "AuP" box to the same place as with 1.0.1. It makes the user's workflow more logic. You enter To: address, set expiry date if you want, select file, *click AuP* and press "Send"
2. I suggest to rename the "upload" button to "Send", make it *big* and reposition it. Right now it sits right next to the "Browse" button. However, the steps a user has to take go from top to bottom. To me it makes more sense to have the "Send" button as the last thing to do in a flow that goes from top to bottom. It needs to big to make sure a user doesn't have to use more effort then needed to both see the button and click on it.
3. Right now, you have a label "select a file", followed by a text box followed by a browse button. Upon selecting a file, the name and size are displayed underneath that textbox. It would make more sense to start with a label "Selected file" followed by an empty field followed by a "Select a file" or "Browse for a file" button. The name would then appear in the empty field, the size underneath, and -if possible- the date the file was last changed if that is an attribute that can be asked for. The text boxes should be un-editable.
ticket.summary: Minor re-order of AuP, "select file" and "upload" + suggested name change

In addition the AuP text is also in English but I think we don't have the option to have different languages for the different templates/dialogues yet?

It would also be nice for the "Upload Complete" notifications (authenticated and using a voucher) to be formatted in the same way, even if it has to be on a new page as it was in 1.0.1.

ticket.description:
We need to know what it would mean to use a "test platform as a service" like Sauce Labs. Sauce Labs offers selenium based testing as a service. For open source projects the service can be used for free.
If such a service could work for us it presumably gives us: - an opportunity to scale testing to many more browsers without incurring an increase in time use - an opportunity to let anyone run tests once tests have been defined. This opens up for including running defined end user workflow tests in the development of new features /fixing of bugs: development is ready once the existing tests succeed
https://saucelabs.com/resources
Create a test account at Sauce Labs, take one feature from FileSender 2.0, for example the "drag and drop file selection" feature, and try to create a Sauce Labs test for this. From their feature list they should have PHP bindings, I would think it would be most convenient for the FileSender project to define its Selenium-server tests in PHP. The Sauce Labs web site has plenty of documentation to get you started :) Sauce Labs allows to import Selenium IDE scripts, which may be useful. Would be convenient to know if there is an effort difference between importing IDE created scripts and writing tests in code.
You can test against https://terasender.uninett.no/branches/filesender-2.0/ until further notice. Login using an OpenIdP account, self-registration should still be possible (OpenIdP is being phased out).
What I'm after is a first impression of using Sauce Labs for practical testing.
ticket.summary: Investigate whole testing chain with Saucelabs for 1 feature and report

ticket.description: It would appear that after a FileSender session has timed out, it is still possible for the user to select and attempt to upload a file. It really shouldn't be possible to attempt an upload if the user is no longer authenticated. Upon subsequent logon, the user may also be taken straight to the Upload page after IdP selection, without being prompted to authenticate again (which may or may not be related). See #425 for some history on this issue.
ticket.summary: Upload attempt possible after session timeout

ticket.description:
We have a number of issues that are labeled "known defficiency in 1.0" that we promised we'd fix in a next version. Most of them will be dealt with, in some way, in FileSender 1.5. To ensure a proper documentation-trail for those issues, we need a way to indicate they *are* fixed in version 1.5, but for those sites using 1.0 they are still an issue.
Thus, we can not *close* them as being bugs, but from a 1.5 (and future) point of view they are no longer a problem. This is part of well-defined and smooth software lifecycle management that serves to give sites running FileSender predictability.
Suggestion is to add a "Fixed in" field to our Assembla tickets. That way we can indicate in 1.0 bugs in which version they were fixed. That ought to solve the problem Good Enough.
ticket.summary: In Assembla Tickets: Add "Fixed In" column in tickets to deal with 1.0 bugs fixed in 1.5

ticket.description:
As discovered and reported by Xander Jansen:
Downloads using Chrome on Win7 *without SP1 or the relevant hotfix* are seemingly OK (no error message) but are incomplete (way too small). Applying a MS Hotfix *or* updating to Win7 SP1 appears to fix the problem.
Even then there is the issue that Win7 still seems to be silent about filled disks :(
Another strange thing is that the Win7 Resource Monitor seems to have a problem measuring the network load when uploading with Chrome. It reports something like 500Kbps when the actual upload performance was more like 30 Mbps or more.
The bug is more or less mentioned/described in http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=21055 (comments 56 and 57 are relevant). Relevant link to Microsoft knowledge base: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2498472
This is NOT a bug in FileSender hence not something we can fix but it *is* an issue that will affect the FileSender user experience and therefore is documented here.
ticket.summary: Problematic downloads using Chrome on Windows7-before-SP1

ticket.description:
When cancelling a file upload, all fields (To:, Subject, Message) are cleared. The assumption is someone would want to upload a new file. That behaviour is suboptimal if the only thing the user wants to do is *send a different file*. Seeing your possibly long message disappear might not be what you're waiting for.
Maybe we should drop the auto clear and make it very easy for a user to clear the form. In a way that's already there, they can press "new upload". So rather than auto-clear, maybe ask on cancel a question of the type "clear form, select new file or quit"?
Thank you NAKAMURA Motonori for bringing this up!

Thx a lot

ticket.description:
With 1.1 using HTML5 and also with 1.0.1 using Gears uploads of a file containg a \ in the filename fails after upload. User gets a 'Cannot move file' popup and on the backend a "Cannot find File in Temp Folder" is logged in the administrator Error logs (accesible from the UI).
This is caused by the way the filename is passed on to the backend on two different occasions in two different ways.
During the upload (of each chunk) the filename is passed through a POST/GET and the \ gets escaped (say hi to the magic quotes :():
[n] => back\\slash.jpg
After the upload when the file is moved from temp storage to final storage the filename is sent in a json-encoded block and the \ is not escaped:
[fileoriginalname] => back\slash.jpg
Since the filename is used for generating a hashed temporary filename on the backend there will be a *different* tempfilename on both occasions and the move will fail.
A structural solution would be to use the same method on both occasions to pass the filename from UI to backend (so any escaping/encoding/etc will be the same) or use one moment in the workflow to generate the tempfilename and use the result on all occasions where the tempfilename is needed.
Workarounds for this case could be:
- put the \ on the list of invalid characters in the filename (function fnCheckString in the flex source in two src files) Needs careful checking on Windows where the \ has a special meaning. - use stripslashes on the input during uploads: this might work but is highly dependent on the 'magic quotes' mess we all learned to love and will definitely introduce complications - turn of magic quotes ? (needs testing and sanity checking)
Note that this will be taken care of in 1.5 in a structural way, see #405
ticket.summary: HTML5 (or Gears) upload with a backslash or double quote in the filename fails

ticket.description:
This weekend I had my slightly tech-fobic mother test cloudstor, version 1.1. She pasted in the email-address she was going to send to, browsed to a file etc., uploaded 200 megs over a very, very , slow link, and then, some hour later, got an error-message from the mailserver that she had used the wrong format email-address. She had pasted in:
*"Firstname Lastname" <firstlast@recipient.org>*
instead of
*firstlast@recipient.org*
Not a very good impression, getting the error after the upload was finished.

ticket.description:
When a recipient clicks on the download link, a web page opens with info and a big download button. The original motivation for doing it this way was practical: we couldn't do direct downloads with the technology choices we'd made. However, this reason is no longer there.
In addition, back in the filesender prototyping days in 2008, I remember reasoning that a user ought to have both options: a direct download-link in the email, clicking on which resulted in the file downloading (and possibly opening in the right application), with in additoin a "click here to learn more about your file before downloading it" anti-phishing link.
We ended up with *only* the anti-phishing option, out of necessity. Now that it is no longer needed, we should revisit this and make it easier.
This ties in with a request I've seen for a "direct download link" to allow tools like wget, curl to download a file directly (automating workflow!). Another good reason to do this is complaints I got from a number of users: the click on the link but the file doesn't open in <relevant app>. So there is a group of users to whom it is more natural to click and see the file open. I suggest we make this happen.
It probably involves some fiddling with sending the right mime-type as well I'd guess.
ticket.summary: Improve download usability: direct download link + correct mime-type?

ticket.description:
We need an easy to manage way to support crowd-sourcing of localisation. Per localisation we need preferably at least 2 volunteers maintaining *that* localisation file and keeping it in sync with the "master". It needs to be easy to see how much of a translation is complete and how much is missing. It also needs to be easy to submit bugs on translations (???)
What should come out of the "translation crowd-sourcing tool" ultimately goes into FileSender releases. Only language files that have at least 1 maintainer can be bundled with the filesender release.
Likely tool/service: https://www.transifex.net/tour/features/translate/
Supported language file formats: http://help.transifex.net/features/formats.html#user-formats
The company: http://www.indifex.com/#
What likely needs to be done is we need to either change our language file format, or implement some gateway.
Why is this important? With all the languages in Europe, we'll soon be swamped with language files that need maintenance....
ticket.summary: Set up crowd-sourcing infra for localisation
Investigate FileSender legal entity option "coop"

ticket.description:
Jeff Hagley, setting up the Internet2 FileSender install, came with this feature request.
Implement real time feedback to the user through the UI on upload/download performance and feedback on that performance relative to what others get.
If we can tell a user "the average person got 80Mbps upload and 83 Mbps download, and here is what you just got/are getting" that would help both the user and the site.
The user has the benefit of knowing whether he's within the reasonable upload/downloadspeed band or whether there is something that might need attention.
The site has the benefit of both marketing a high speed high quality network "upload through your NREN and life is good", and enabling a user to figure out whether the problem is their bandwidth/desktop or whether there might be a service issue.
Blue sky dream: something a-la SURFnet-Detective for FileSender specific. Give users real time feedback on upload/download performance, and on said performance compared to other users. In addition, allow them to do a pre-upload check on performance. AdobeConnect does this, as do many DDoS clients. That pre-upload check might then include other checks, a sort of "can I do FileSender and how fast can I do it" check. Lastly would be great to include some way to help users diagnose possible problems.
Now this looks remarkably like the SURFnet detective but then FileSender specific.
It would require stuff in the UI. Where we'd put it is probably clear when we've sorted out the "where do we put advanced functionality without cluttering the basic functionality" question. In addition there is backend code that needs to be written.
Jeff suggested this could work with PerfSonar.
ticket.summary: Real time upload/download performance feedback

ticket.description:
Current naming scheme of the language files deviates from Best Current Practices (as defined by BCP 47 and related ICU/ISO guidelines). Main deviation being the use of lower/upper case of language and country tags. To prevent confusion we should go to the following filename naming scheme:
<language>_<COUNTRY>
<language> is the shortest two/three letter ISO 639 language code in lowercase <COUNTRY> (or better perhaps <REGION>) is the ISO 3166-1 country/region/territory code in UPPERcase
Use of "_" (underscore) in filenames follows the convention for defining 'locales' on modern Linux/Unix systems (and defined/allowd by the related Unicode/ICU definitions, see [[url:http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unicode_Language_and_Locale_Identifiers|http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unicode_Language_and_Locale_Identifiers]] )
Note that browser tags for language preference use the "-" hyphen (as defined in BCP 47)
Changing this in beta2 has two advantages: 1) use of well used standard for naming locales (for filenames). 2) no mix-up with 'old-style' language definitions in ./config (see related ticket #657)
Re 2) Since we decided to move the distribution provided './config' language definitions to the main files in ./language', left-overs in '/.config' should not be used anymore unless they cotain local modifications. A side effect of renaming all language files now will be that the 'left-overs' in './config' won't be used anymore so the actual (and possibly changed) definitions in the './language' dir will always be used. pre-beta2 users can be directed to move local customisations (and only those) to a file according to the 'new' scheme.
ticket.summary: Restructure naming of language files

ticket.description:
Suggested feature contributed by Tilburg University/Thijs:
"> Within our organisation there was the desire that files get not simply > > unlinked when they are expired but are wiped from disk by overwriting them > > with random data. This tries to combat the effect of filesender's filestore > > becoming a goldmine of assorted documents that would be easy to recover - > > somewhat like the infamous printer hard drives. > > > > Attached patch implements this.
As discussed with Xander, here's an updated version of the patch that makes the shred command configurable as well."
ticket.summary: Add option to secure wipe files in cron.php

ticket.description:
Suggested feature from Tilburg University/Thijs to make non-UI-based downloads (with wget/curl/fetch) easier.
Alternatives could be to include a link in the email and download-page to the direct-download. To be decided/reviewed in the beta3 cycle.
"We received as user feedback that they want to have an URL from filesender that they can use to download the file on the command line (with wget or curl for example).
The 'user story' is that the user is working on an ADSL link from home. He receives an ISO via filesender from which he wants to boot a virtual machine. With current filesender the user is not provided with an URL to download the ISO directly, only one that works with JavaScript only. He wants to be able to have an URL that he can feed to wget to download the ISO straight to the right server, not first download to his workstation only to upload it again to the server over ADSL.
It can be assumed that in many cases where receiving huge files, you want to use them in a context which is not your local workstation.
The fix turned out rather simple: the Start Download button uses JavaScript document.location to start the download. However, there's no need for this (anymore). Therefore, I've moved the download URL from the JavaScript into the href attribute. The onClick remains to display the informational message. Users that know how to use wget will know how to right-click on the Start Download button and copy the URL that they need."
ticket.summary: Make 'direct downloads' easier

ticket.description:
Quoting Thijs:
"the filesender version number is displayed twice: both at the top-right and bottom of the page; the second one is not influenced by the 'versionNumber' setting from config.php, so I've removed that one altogether."
Propose to do this for all actual releases but not on the development branches/trunk. Or we could move the second display to a HTML commented part in the output (on the assumption that the second one in the footer is meant to always have some indication on the version running for debug-purposes). I also think we should keep the footer <div> (can be empty).

ticket.description: Thijs (as an experienced debian packager) suggested both on- and offline some usefull improvements to the debian packaging. Based on the suggestions Thijs and I decided that going to a more modern way (using some other tooling) of debian packaging is the way forward. This (including MySQL/dbconfig) will be looked at in more detail in the beta3 cycle.
ticket.summary: Improvements to debian packaging

ticket.description:
Currently we have two directories in the code tree for the 'history' javascript library: www/lib/history and www/lib/js/history The files in these two directories are identical. I can't find any reference to this library in the code anymore and they most likely were used for the Flash UI in 1.1.
Can we safely remove those two directories?
ticket.summary: Do we still need history.js libs?

ticket.description:
Now is a good time to remove unused and obsolete settings from config-dist.php.
- settings that now are localised but still there commented - unused settings
Note that $config['datedisplayformat'] is localised for all UI-screens but is still used in Mail.php
ticket.summary: Clean up config-dist.php

ticket.description: When the "My Files" table is empty the text "There are currently no files available" is displayed beneath the table headings. It could be nice to display some equivalent text when the "Guest Voucher" table is empty. Note that in 1.1 the subheading "Current Valid Vouchers" was included above the voucher table, but this doesn't really seem necessary together with the main heading. So perhaps a message when the voucher table is empty could be "There are currently no valid vouchers"? Otherwise "There are currently no vouchers available".
ticket.summary: Empty Guest Voucher table text

ticket.description:
SimpleSamlphp throws up a feedback form whenever something "really bad" happens. The ease of reporting critical errors makes people actually report those. FileSender should have something like that. For example when a "$lang["_DISK_SPACE_ERROR"]" is thrown, that a pointer to the instances standard problem reporting mechanisms is included. Or even better: a standard form. Something like that.
This feature suggestion is to comb through the language file and identify logical points where to do that. Second stage is to implement a practical way to make user feedback easy but only when you as service admin *really* want it: when stuf unexpectedly has gone wrong. Maybe a standard feedback form or something.
ticket.summary: Facilitate feedback-points in warnings/errors

ticket.description: Coming up soon from Victoriano Giralt and Francisco Sánchez Benavides
ticket.summary: Add spanish translations

ticket.description: Referring to the discussion in #699: when adding a user to a file, should that entry pop up right above the existing file, or should it popup "latest added first"? Having some logic sort options in the MyFiles table might be helpful in general. Note that also "how to display "multiple file uploads" will be an interesting one.

This content should be left-aligned without a background, as per other contents on this page. Also the "Start Download" button is now small and left-centred.

(To note only: if one does not enter an email address at all, the warning correctly (as discussed in #695) does not appear until after clicking on "Send (Voucher)" in both workflows).

ticket.description: In the "Help" popup, all links open in new tabs before and after logon with FF 12.0 on Mac OSX and IE9 on Windows7 (Flash 11.2.202.235). After logon, all links also redirect with FF 12.0 on Mac OSX, however the "Adobe Flash" and "www.filesender.org" links direct back to the top of the "Help" popup with IE9 on Windows7 (Flash 11.2.202.235).

ticket.description: After pausing (HTML5) or cancelling (Flash) an authenticated upload the AUP box remains checked. However for an upload using a voucher (in both the HTML5 and Flash cases) the AUP check box is reset to unchecked. Resetting to unchecked may be better, as the user has not completed the upload yet and would be in keeping with the fact that all other fields on the page already reset. Note also that if I cancel an upload using a voucher (while unauthenticated), then logon, the AUP box is checked in the authenticated tab.

ticket.description:
Currently the Logon page has one textstring defined which is used for both the page heading and the logon button: lang("_LOGON")
Making a separate definition for the pageheading gives more flexibility.

ticket.description:
Currently the _SITE_SPLASH_TEXT on the landing page uses the fixes "FileSender" name. We could (just as in _ABOUT_TEXT) replace that with the site_name variable.
Indirectly suggested by Guido.
ticket.summary: Feature request: use $config['site_name'] in _SITE_SPLASHTEXT (and similar)

ticket.description:
When comparing browser language tags with defined languages 'weighted' tags won't work because the weight isn't stripped from the tag. This happens when the most preferred browser language is *not* defined for filesender but one of the lesse preferred browser language is. For example:
[0] => af [1] => nl;q=0.9 [2] => en-us;q=0.8 [3] => en;q=0.7 [4] => de;q=0.6 [5] => it-ch;q=0.5 [6] => no;q=0.5 [7] => nb;q=0.4 [8] => sl;q=0.3 [9] => it;q=0.2
af (Afrikaans) is not available but dutch (nl) is but that one won't be selected because of the exact string comparison.
Spotted and patch supplied by Csillag Tamas.
ticket.summary: Language tag comparison broken for less preferred languages

ticket.description:
We don't yet have a working auto-complete in the To: field.
1. investigate whether expliciltly switching on "autocomplete" in the forms definition helps 2. implement a google-style ajax auto-complete (http://jqueryui.com/demos/autocomplete/)
ticket.summary: Auto-complete in To: field

ticket.description:
As reported by Claude Tompers of RESTENA: "the page counter for the download logs in my administration section are running out of my screen. Wouldn't it be better to have something like :
<< First page < Prev. page Page X/Y Next page > Last page >>
This would scale better."
I agree and this would be a good starting point for improved web-based admin pages.

ticket.description:
Figure 2, Figure 3, linked to eachother, will fix for beta4
Figure 4: we use encoding but might not be best way for particular encoding need at that point in time. This will be part of structural robustness increase in ticket X
Figure 5: includes/ErrorHandler.php lacks output sanitisation, will fix for beta4.
ticket.summary: Security audit: 2.7.6: fix 2 uncovered overlooked output sanitisation issues

ticket.description: As far as we can tell this is already the case and the documentation seems correct. Xander will clarify with security auditor where the exact issue is.
ticket.summary: Security audit: 2.2.1: store all temporary, user-uploaded and php “include” files outside the document root

ticket.description:
Xander: "Advice doesn't take into account that FileSender should be regarded as a MUA, all use of FS is authenticated and is not different from using a normal MUA. Just as with a normal MUA the user has indeed the ability to spam. The risk of blacklisting can be mitigated with a configurable max-recipient limit in FS or outside of FS on the sending MTA with standard rate-limiting measures.
Using CAPTCHA's or comparable is nice for a simple webform where you can get to without real authentication but this item from the checklist just does not apply to FileSender."
note Jan: irrelevant because FileSender has *authenticated* users, and adding captcha adds inconvenience for users.
ticket.summary: Security audit 2.10.1: Require users to solve a CAPTCHA when they send many files

ticket.description:
Xander: "Currently session_destroy() is used which clears all session variables *except* the PHPSESSID. The PHPSESSID cookie *should* be reset with the setcookie(session_name(),'') call but after investigation it appears that that does not work (anymore?) as intended. However adding a expiry time in the past and the 'path' to the setcookie call fixes that and forces the client to delete the 'compromised' cookie after which a new session cookie is generated on the SSL-connection. Non-committed patch is running on proto"
Security auditors suggestion "regenerate session id" is probably not the best solution, what we do (and should do) is to *remove*, destroying all variables on the unsecured session when you move to the secured session. Patch is now commited, rv1556.
Fix will not be applied to 1.1.1.
ticket.summary: Security audit: 2.11.3: Use the session_regenerate_id() function after switching to a SSL connection.

ticket.description:
"The cookies that hold the session id have to be secured with certain flags. The secure flag instructs the browser to only send a cookie over HTTPS requests. This helps to prevent interception of the session id."
This is a recommendation for PHP-setup (in the supplied php.ini sample config file) and left to the administrator to enforce or not depending on the setup. Suggested feature for after 1.5 (configurable like in SSP). Was already a known issue and candidate for hardening document.
; If your FileSender is only available over https (which it should be), enable ; the following to have secure session cookies ; ; session.cookie_secure = On ; session.cookie_httponly = On
See also ticket #758
For longer term, this would better be enforced by FileSender to prevent "shoot yourself in the foot". SimpleSAMLphp has this, and could possibly be copied.
ticket.summary: Security audit: 2.11.4: Set the secure flag on the session cookie using session_set_cookie_params().

ticket.description:
Recommendation: At moment of login, re-initialise all variables including php_sessionId to prevent session fixation.
Impact score in audit is low, not deemed directly dangerous for now. This requires more research and impact analysis, to be done post.1.5 release.
ticket.summary: Security audit 2.11.2: Use the session_regenerate_id function when the user logs in to prevent session fixation.

ticket.description: Is recommendation for PHP-setup. Suggested feature for after 1.5 (configurable like in SSP). See also 2.11.4. (#759)
ticket.summary: Security audit 2.11.5: Set the httponly flag on the session cookie using session_set_cookie_params().

ticket.description: During discussion it was unclear exactly why this would be an issue. Xander to clarify with Pine Security.
ticket.summary: Security audit: 2.6.2: Add an access check to the admin page

ticket.description:
From the report:
"Issue: When the user can specify a filename, the application has to check if the filename does not contain unexpected values. For example, allowing a filename like ../file can lead to a "path traversal" problem.
Result: The Filesender application properly encodes user input before it is used within filenames. The following function could be improved, since it only replaces the first dot with an underscore, but all user input is hashed with md5 and therefore safe. This checklist item is marked as “Passed”."
Deferred because not currently an issue. For after 1.5: need to make a decision, either drop the function (in practice we use the hash where it matters) or fix it to prevent issues should we ever use the function for anything else. Client-side the browsers protect users against malicious-filenames-on-download.
ticket.summary: Security audit: 2.7.2: Change sanitizeFilename to filter out all bad characters

ticket.description:
Well-spotted by Vegard Polden.
We have a field "logtime" that is not used. It is only present in the database scripts:
scripts/filesender_db.sql: logtime time with time zone, scripts/mysql_filesender_db.sql: `logtime` time DEFAULT NULL,
Chris replies that this is deprecated. We one time planned to use separate fields for date and time but ended up using one field for both. So we have to get rid of that field.
-remove the field from both database scripts -add to upgrade notes some database command to remove that deprecated field from existing databases
All of course pending X acknowledge
ticket.summary: remove logtime from database scripts

ticket.description:
So far we made sure output that was the result of user input got sanitised. A recommendation in the May 2012 security audit is to apply output sanitisation to *all* possible output, making FileSender more hardened against unexpected consequences of changing language files, config files etc. and hardening better against unexpected avenues of attack.
This requires a systematic effort to go through *all* output generating functionality and:
-check whether output sanitisation is done -if not done, apply output sanitisation -verify that the most optimal output sanitisation function is applied for that particular context (place in workflow, point in time)
ticket.summary: Security audit 2.7.6: prevent shoot-in-foot, harden more by also sanitising output not user-generated
Add sessionid to log data table

If I am logged on to FileSender and then load https://filesender.surfnet.nl/preview/, https://filesender.surfnet.nl/preview/index.php?s=vouchers or https://filesender.surfnet.nl/preview/index.php?s=files in another browser tab, behaviour is as expected.

If I then refresh the first tab I am also presented with the logon page. When clicking on "Logon" again, after selecting the IdP the IdP's authentication is bypassed. If I then refresh the page in the second tab, I am logged on again in that tab also.

ticket.description: When 'clicking' (manually or using a script) on the "Send" button multiple times (prior to or after the progress bar appears) during an upload, the following has been observed (HTML5 case with Firefox 15.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8). Xander suggests that this may be a symptom of #641 / #663. 1. *Clicking again prior to progress bar appearing (authenticated):* progress bar at multiples of 100% (e.g. 200%, 300% etc), with a horizontal scrollbar (because the progress bar extends beyond the 100%), otherwise as expected. 2. *Clicking again prior to progress bar appearing (using voucher):* progress bar at multiples of 100% (as above) plus one of the following. The file did not appear in the "My Files" table, and no emails were generated to advise that the file had been uploaded. However the voucher could no longer be used and vanished from the "Guest Voucher" table. - either an error at the top of the page with a green background "Error accessing server", or - a popup "You are no longer authenticated. Your session may have expired or there has been a server error. Please logon again and re-try.". After clicking on OK / the close symbol, the page loaded "This voucher has already been used.". Automatically logged off. 3. *Clicking again after progress bar appearing (authenticated):* each time I clicked on "Send" (after the initial click) the error "Invalid or missing email" kept appearing under the recipient email address. *The "Welcome Guest" page appeared (which should have been "Welcome [first name surname]"* with "Your file has been uploaded and message sent.". Otherwise as expected. 4. *Clicking again after progress bar appearing (authenticated):* as per 3., but *voucher was not deleted after use*.
ticket.summary: Unexpected behaviour when clicking on Send multiple times during upload

ticket.description:
On (at least) Mac OSX filenames with certain Unicode characters tend to be represented as 'decomposed unicode' (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode_equivalence for an explanation). Although FileSender transparantly handles those decomposed characters and leaves the actual handling to the browser and OS it looks like most notably Windows (when storing a file with 'decomposed unicode' characters from FireFox/Chrome) and IE11 (when displaying those files in My Files or a download page) doesn't handle those characters as expected.
We might consider 'fixing' this in FileSender by normalizing 'decomposed unicode' to 'precomposed unicode'.
Considerations: - The normalizer_normalize function of the PHP intl extension can be used for this, this requires PHP 5.3+ and adds extra dependencies (php5-intl, libicu) - Should we normalize when uploading (before storing the filename into the database) or only when displaying/downloading?
ticket.summary: Handling decomposed unicode in filenames

ticket.description:
Under some very specific conditions the logs might get polluted with: 
E_ERROR: No mapping for en-au found. Please check your language configuration.
This will happen when: - a customised config/locale.php does *NOT* contain a mapping for en-au - $config['site_defaultlanguage'] is either "en_AU" or not defined - none of the language tags sent by the browser is found in the customised config/locale.php The 'error' here is that the en-au => en_AU.php mapping is not present in the customised config/locale.php Stricty speaking this shouldn't be an error since in all cases FileSender will use the default en_AU.php definitions. The specific error message is meant to detect for example a missing mapping when $config['site_defaultlanguage'] is *not* "en_AU" and the corresponding mapping in locale.php is missing.
ticket.summary: "E_ERROR: No mapping for en-au found" when no mapping for default language is found

ticket.description: In pages/multidownload.php, the checkboxes for the files are currently all unchecked when the page loads. It would probably be more intuitive to have them all checked by default, as it is more reasonable to assume that a user wants to download all of the files in the group.
ticket.summary: Make all files selected by default on multidownload.php

ticket.description: As accidently stumbled upon by Jan: html links don't have a specific style definition in default.css. For some situations (for example the help/about popups) the jquery defaults are taken but for example the links in My Files or when you add a link in the footer div in index.php will be styled according to the browser defaults. This will give you mismatching colours. We could add some general styles for links to default.css .
ticket.summary: No default style definitions for links in default.css

ticket.description: Need to ensure that two files (matching filenames) cannot appear in the upload box together.
ticket.summary: Preventing duplicate entries in upload box

ticket.description: As spotted by Wendy and confirmed on my Win7 box: when the page resets (with IE9 at least) after cancelling an upload, Selenium doesn't recognise that the page has finished resetting (and times out before advancing to the next step). I had originally thought this was a quirk of Selenium (which doesn't always handle waiting as expected), however I noticed that the mouse pointer keeps spinning.
ticket.summary: IE9 mouse pointer keeps spinning after canceling an upload

ticket.description: when the filestore is full, have an ability to overflow to another filestore. Example: own primary disk, is full, overflow to amazon's S3 until you upgrade your own primary disk store. Question would be where to do this: in the application or on the filesystem.
ticket.summary: multiple storage backend locations [xl]

ticket.description: in www/index.php: To install Flash Player got to Adobe.com. -> To install Flash Player go to Adobe.com.

minor problems with the DoneLoading kludge

ticket.description:
We're using the standard download functionality of browsers and the download manager of for example firefox supports pausing a download but not a download from FileSender 1.5. Safari doesn't support pause/resume downloads.
The question is -should we make FireFox's (and other browser's) pause/resume work or not? -should we go further and implement a more generic pause/resume mechanism and if so, why? -would we automatically get this if we implement "direct download link" functionality?
Too many unanswered questions and not enough user pressure to make this a first priority.
ticket.summary: Implement pause/resume for downloads

ticket.description: Change chunk size depending on file size to provide a smooth progress bar.
ticket.summary: Javascript/HTML5 upload chunk size to suit progress bar

ticket.description: - The width of the download window in the flash UI seems to be determined by filesubject and filename but *not* by filemessage . Having a short subject and a short filename but a rather lenghty filemessage still gives a small 'window'. - Using a really long filesubject oveflows the window
ticket.summary: Variable width of download window quirks

ticket.description: Should we add a simple message for people that have JavaScript disabled stating that they should enable it to work with filesender?

ticket.description: Current text is: "FileSender is an installation of FileSender ...." This looks like the original intent of the text was to replace the first 'FileSender' with the site_name config setting. Proposed patch in trunk with changeset 440. This will replcae the first instance of 'FileSender' with for example 'CloudStor' if that is the configured site_name. This is a minor patch not touching core functionality.

ticket.description: when running filesender from the default URL (<server>/filesender/) the favicon.ico (still a cloudstor version btw) is not used on the secondary pages (help/about./logout etc), when running from the root (<server>/ ) it is. Left for a next release.

With an authenticated Flash upload the custom subject IS cleared after canceling the upload. Seen with IE8 on Win7. Propose to leave this as a know deficiency.

ticket.description: This is inconsistent with the Gears upload.

ticket.description: The various (file?) listings in the Administrator view can be presented 'outside' the default screen, probably needs the same fix as #465

ticket.description: Seen with IE9: when deleting a file from a long My Files list (i.e. longer than the browser window height) the confirmation pop-up appears at or below the bottom of the browser window. It looks like it is centered on the page height instead of the (visible) window height.

ticket.description: Patch against 1.5 (r627, so might be off now) from Dyonisius Visser which replaces the 'hard coded' eduPersonTargetedID label with the more appropriate value of $config['saml_uid_attribute']. Note that this is already done in the code but this patch (or similar) will make the code more clear.

ticket.summary: Administrator General tab: % use not shown

ticket.description: Due to changes in the FileSender default.css the themefilesender simplesamlphp module needs to be adapted a litte bit. Might be done by including both the stock default.css of SimpleSAMLphp *and* the FileSender default.css. Testing shows that that seems to work and might just need minor tweaks in the FileSender.default.css. Now if only I knew why the button-style changed to 'full screen width' ;-)

ticket.description:
For post-1.5 consideration.
When using Norwegian I noticed that the word "størrelse" is larger then the space allocated in the "size" table column header. It looks as if the fields don't auto-size which is what can be expected if we wish to have the FileSender width to be constant. I don't know if there's a clever way around this but would like us to think a bit about it *after* 1.5 is away.
ticket.summary: Cosmetic & non-blocking: MyFiles table headers don't auto-size

ticket.description:
In many cases when users for whatever reason use the "back" button of the browser they will go back to a SimpleSAMLphp page which in most cases reults in an error page like: 
Exception: State information lost, and no way to restart the request.

0: /usr/share/simplesamlphp/lib/SimpleSAML/Auth/State.php:158 (SimpleSAML_Auth_State::loadState)
1: /usr/share/simplesamlphp/modules/saml/www/sp/saml2-acs.php:24 (require)
2: /usr/share/simplesamlphp/www/module.php:135 (N/A)

URL:
https://filesender.surfnet.nl/simplesaml/module.php/saml/sp/saml2-acs.php/default-sp
This is a common case when using SSP (not only with FileSender) and I'm not sure if it is fixable or where it should be 'fixed'. A few posibilities to handle this: - Disable the Back button (if possible but even when it is possible it looks intrusive/confusing to do that) - Leave it as is and make a FAQ entry - Do a 'redirect' from the/a first FileSender landing page to the 'New Upload' page so that when people do use the Back button they go back to a FileSender page and not a SSP page ? FYI: at SURFnet I almost get no support questions (it does seem to work without questions for most people) except for the occasional error report about this one. Jan also got them at UNINETT. My standard reply ("Don't use the Back button") somehow doesn't feel good ;-) It does happen in 1.0/1,1 but also in 1.5 if you never leave the New Upload page.
ticket.summary: Use of the "back" browser button gives SimpleSAMLphp error

ticket.description:
When downloading a file with a " in the filename the actual download suggests a 'broken' filename (the part up till the "). For example:
test".jpg -> test
Quick fix (for 1.1) is to replace all double quotes in the filename with _ in the content-disposition header.
Note that it is possible to upload files with a " in the name with Flash. See also #601 .
ticket.summary: Download of file with double quote in filename breaks content-disposition header

ticket.description:
When using Opera the UI is visibly build up in 'steps'. First the text of the pages is very shortly visible after which the buttons and images are 'applied'. Furthermore I noticed (mainly on the Mac and Linux versions) that pressing a button will move the page contents up a few pixels without doing the intended action. Pressing the button again after the 'shift' up does work. This gives a somewhat 'nervous' impression.
Tested against r1113 of FileSender 1.5 with Opera 11.60 on Win7, Linux and MacOSX 10.5.8 (note: cache cleared and browser restarted)
ticket.summary: Style sheet/screen building issues with Opera

ticket.description: When using IE7 (or IE9 in IE7 mode) the layout is a bit garbled. On all (authenticated) pages the menu buttons on the right are shifted down and on the voucher page the explanatory text is not spanned over the columns.
ticket.summary: IE7 screen layout

ticket.description:
When using the Suhosin PHP plugin (not the 'patch') on the server uploads fail due to an (old) default Suhosin setting which appears to be incompatible with IE8+
Solution is (according to http://www.hardened-php.net/suhosin/changelog.html ):
Disable suhosin.session.cryptua by default because of Internet Explorer 8 "features"
This default is set to Off as of Suhosin plugin Version 0.9.28.
Note that this setting is also active when running Suhosin in simulation mode.
ticket.summary: Uploads fail when using Suhosin plugin (PHP hardening) and IE8+

ticket.description: When you start an upload between 23:00 and 24:00 on a day in 'wintertime' and the maximum expiry date is on a date after switching to summer time the shown and sent maximum expiry date will be one day off (later than the 'expected' day).
ticket.summary: Daylight savings time issue with server side based maximum expiry date

ticket.description:
It might be useful to provide users with an unobtrusive per-file-opt-in mechanism that (provided they opt in) would provide them with notification of imminent expiry of a file -- they could use this notification event to take actions such as ringing their intended recipients in a last-ditch effort to get them to download the soon-to-be-no-longer-available file, or re-upload a new file or a replacement file.
Off the top of my head I could think of the attaching of an iCalendar TODO event along with the your-file-is-now-available email; users could decide for themselves whether to import the event in the iCalendar file into their personal calendars. Xander warns me that some groupware email clients (Zimbra?) automatically import such iCalendar files into their user calendars, without consulting the user.
More exotically, perhaps per-user-per-file RSS subscriptions are possible? Per-user tweets? Per-user facebook wall messages? Suggestions very welcome.
ticket.summary: provide opt-in mechanism to notify of imminent file expiry

ticket.description:
The layout of the upload page doesn't adapt to the rather long length of the 'choose file' input element used in Chrome and Chromium browsers. This causes a slight overlap with other text areas on the upload page when using Chrome/Chromium. See attached picture (as reported by Andrej Bagon/Arnes). Note that this is most annoying when using a language where the "_HTML5Supported" language tag is a bit longer (all languages except English ;-). Workaround is to insert a
in the _HTML5Supported tag but a more structural way (if possible) might be nice. Note that this can be postponed to after 1.5 if it is too complex.
ticket.summary: Chrome 'choose file' input area overlaps other text areas in upload page

ticket.description:
As Wendy noticed: Looking at the tab titles, I noticed that while loading etc. the title can switch momentarily between "FileSender" and "surfnet.nl". Also, after the upload page reloads after cancelling a Flash upload, the tab title changes to "FileSender#" "
This is most notably (only?) with IE9 on Win7.
ticket.summary: Tab/Window titles change with IE9/Win7

ticket.description:
Current documentation states: 
To allow for larger files and longer execution times you will need to edit these lines:

max_input_time(in seconds)
upload_max_filesize(in M)
post_max_size (in M)

NOTE: Remember to change filesender $config['max_flash_upload_size'] to match your upload_max_filesize.If they are not the same FileSender will use the lowest value as the actual maximum upload size for Flash uploads.

Reasonable values are:

max_input_time = 3600
upload_max_filesize = 2047M
post_max_size = 2146445312 ; 2047M + 10K
These settings are as is distributed in the config-templates/filesender-php.ini file. In practice this restricts Flash-uploads to 2047MB (base 1024) which is slightly less than the 2GB limit (base 1024) advertised in the help (note: the limit in the help text is the 2047M value rounded to the nearest GB) which is confusing in case a file larger than 2047MB but smaller than 2GB is tried but refused). We might want to review these recommended settings (why is it set to 2047MB? Is this still needed? etc...)
ticket.summary: Review current recommended PHP settings in documentation and sample ini file

ticket.description: The table rows in My Files have alternating colors but when there is more than 1 file available the first two rows have the same color and the alternating color only starts in the third row. In the Vouchers table this 'skipping of the first row' is not happening. The fix in [[r:1501]] makes the alternating consistent between the two pages *but* when the MyFiles table is empty the message "There are currently no files available' is 'gray' but only for the first 7 columns, leaving a 'white' block for the remainder of the row. On the Vouchre page the row with "There are currently no vouchers available" is completely 'white' (no alternative coloring). This very minor detail could probably be fixed in beta4.
ticket.summary: Use of alternating colors in MyFiles table
Update emailbouncehandler.php for 1.5

ticket.description: As suggested (with contributed patch) by Thijs the dependency on php-gmp can be removed by changing/simplifying the chekIp6() function. Can be done with inet_pton() or with the filter_var($ip, FILTER_VALIDATE_IP, FILTER_FLAG_IPV6) function.
ticket.summary: Remove dependency on php-gmp by simplifying IPv6 check

ticket.description: When canceling a Flash upload the temporary file on the server is not available/removed (standard PHP mechanism) and move_uploaded_file() will return FALSE. This is always (regardless of reason) logged on the server as an ERROR in www/fs_upload.php although in this case (and possibly others) it is normal behaviour. This might be improved by looking at the specific reason (see http://www.php.net/manual/en/features.file-upload.errors.php ). For now left as a known issue.
ticket.summary: A normal Flash upload cancel generates E_ERROR (file NOT moved)

ticket.description:
When an upload complete, a dialog appears stating that the upload has completed. This is good. But it closes in 15 seconds, after which is redirects to the upload page again, which then shows no indication of that the previous upload succeeded.
This is annoying if you leave the computer while uploading completes, because you have to do extra work to check that the upload succeeded. Even more so if you checked the «Get a link instead of sending to recipients» checkbox, because then you must find the link in «My Transfers».
ticket.summary: Upload complete dialog should not auto-close

ticket.description: Change upload button to DIV to remove # from URL when selecting upload
ticket.summary: Change upload button to DIV

ticket.description: There are two exact replicas of Tsunami.php; one under the 'classes' directory and one in www/lib/tsunami/php. The sensible place to have this file is under classes, so the other copy should be removed.
ticket.summary: Remove duplicate Tsunami.php file
space between admins in $config['admin'] means second admin won't have admin access

ticket.description: Currently a voucher can be used exactly 1 time within the validity period. It should be possible to allow a voucher to be used X times.
ticket.summary: Allow voucher to be used multiple times

ticket.description:
One of the obvious issues with the emails that FileSender sends out is that users have become weary of mails that say 'download the cool file here!'. A way to make our emails somewhat more trustworthy is to digitally sign them. Note that this would be a longer term feature suggestion.
Possible ways of implementing this: http://www.cynergi.com/function-send-email-digital-signature-attachments-php.html http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1487680/signed-email-in-php/1491634
Before thinking of implementing it we would probably want to get some experience with signed emails using some signing email gateway.
ticket.summary: allow to send emails S/MIME signed [L]

ticket.description:
We currently implement the explicit tickbox AuP method.
An alternative might be the implicit clickable link with "by using this service you agree to the AuP".
ticket.summary: Terms of Service / AUP link: legal requirements
